story:
Success!
We were able to make a down payment on the dog. $1500. The remainder of the money earned from this campaign has went towards stage 2.


Follow our campaign online at battle-buddy.org  and facebook .

 

 
Why is Kenny raising funds instead of the VA providing it?
Find out why at nbcnews.com 

Ask Kenny questions or read questions others have already asked on reddit .

My name is Jon and my older brother, Kenny Bass is a disabled Marine combat veteran from the Iraq War. He served with the Marine infantry for the first 8 months of the war.  He was wounded during a counter-ambush patrol, he was hit with an IED, and has suffered PTSD and multiple other physical injuries due to his combat service since 2004. He was diagnosed with Behcets Disease in 2007 that has been linked to his anthrax and smallpox vaccinations. The Behcets disease causes him to suffer severe arthritic joint pain, chronic fatigue, neuropathy, painful sores, and multiple other debilitating symptoms. 

http://www.behcets.com/site/pp.asp?c=bhJIJSOCJrH&b=260548 

He has spent the last 8 years of his life in treatment for his PTSD, and now is in need of a PTSD service dog that will enable him to leave his house again and begin rebuilding his life outside of his home.

PROGRESS
Kenny has been working with Mike Hale, Marine Vietnam Veteran, and owner of Instinctive Guardians in New York [ .com  | facebook  ]. Yesterday Kenny received the contract and was able to speak with Mike to nail down the specific costs involved, and timeline for the specialized training.   The costs will include traveling to Instinctive Guardians in New York to meet the trainer, Mike, be introduced to the available dogs and ultimately choose one that will then go to San Diego for further specialized training.  Prior to the completion of the BH training in San Diego, Kenny will travel there to meet with Mike Hale, and Mark Viera of Von Viera Shepards for training and the graduation ceremonies.  Upon completion of BH training, the service dog will then return to Instinctive Guardians in New York for the training specific to Kenny's specific PTSD related needs.  Then Kenny will travel to Instinctive Guardians to complete the final service dog team training, to include the American Red Cross' certification in Pet First Aid and CPR,  becoming a certified service dog team, and officially take ownership of the service dog. Now Kenny can return home, begin rebuilding his life, and start the recovery process. 

The service dogs available through Instinctive Guardians are West German Shepards with championship blood lines.  Presently, the four available service dogs at Instinctive Guardians are the grandchildren of Odin Vom Holtkamper Hof, and Hill Vom Ferbenspiel.  The grandfather, Odin, is the 2005 18-24 month Sieger VA1, 2008 VA2, and the 2008 Chinese Sieger VA1.  The grndmother, Hill, is the 2004 Sieger VA2.  These German Shepards not only receive the (CGC) Canine Good Citizen training, but also the (AD) Assistance Dog training, the (BH) Begleithund training (Traffic Steady Companion Dog), as well undergoing obedience testing by an impartial german judge and being graded accordingly.

See pictures of the available dogs here 

 

These psychological service dogs spend years in training and are very expensive. Withouit raising these funds it would be impossible for my brother to pay for a properly trained service dog on his own.  Once he is paired with a psychological service dog, he will be able retrain himself to live a functional life in a civilian setting (through the aid of a service dog) and learn to lead more of a normal life again, not only for himself but for his wife and two young children.  The service dog would assist in bringing him out of flashbacks and help keep him grounded in reality, the dog would wake him when he is having nightmares, And it would especially help him when he is in public(he tends to get overwhelmed and angry), the dog would assist in creating a buffer around him in crowds, and allow him to feel more secure. A service dog will give my brother and his family their lives back. 

 

 

 

 

Any of the funds raised that exceed the expenses related to obtaining the service dog will be put towards his pursuit of specialized medical treatments(travel expenses to and from the national Bechets conference and to out of state Behcets Disease experts).

Contributors interested in updates on kenny and his new battle buddy will have the opportunity to receive full access to a blog that will detail the process of their first meeting, the intensive training, the homecoming to meet the family, and their experiences together as they begin their new life as Battle Buddies.  The blog will include pictures, video, and details about Kenny's personal journey.   

I have spoke to my brother about the possibilities of obtaining a service dog and he believes that once he is paired with his new "battle buddy", that he will be better prepared to face the daily challenges that PTSD presents.   I believe that he made a sacrifice for his country, one that he struggles with daily and that his need is as important as any other. Help me show him that his sacrifice is important and deserving of our support.

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Please SHARE this campaign and help spread the word with Indiegogo's share tools. 

Thank you for your help in accomplishing our goal!

I have spoke to my brother about the possibilities of obtaining a service dog and he believes that once he is paired with his new "battle buddy", that he will be better prepared to face the daily challenges that PTSD presents.   I believe that he made a sacrifice for his country, one that he struggles with daily and that his need is as important as any other. Help me show him that his sacrifice is important and deserving of our support.


Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Please SHARE this campaign and help spread the word with Indiegogo's share tools. 
Thank you for your help in accomplishing our goal!

story:
Short Summary

Uplifting, LLC will be a specialty bra store lifting cups D through N.  Related products such as underwear, active wear, lingerie, and lingerie care products will be sold as well. The purpose of Uplifting is to provide women with large busts in the Houston area with a greater variety of quality bras and intimate apparel. Uplifting will eliminate the common act of ‘settling’ for a bra, and replace it with the act of ‘falling in love’ with a bra. An “uplifting experience” will allow customers’ hidden, and sometimes forgotten, inner beauty and confidence to resurface.

My mission is to provide quality bras and service to women with large bust sizes; assuring women that they are wearing their correct bra sizes, aware of which bra styles offer their personal comfort and support preferences, and always have an uplifting experience that yields uplifting confidence.

 

                        

 

What We Need & What You Get

Every pledge will contribute to allowing me to fulfill the vision and mission of Uplifting, LLC. I am proud and excited to introduce a bra store with a new concept, offering new brands to the northern Houston Area with the help of all of you.

Your contributions will assist in:

-Securing the location

-Covering build out costs

-Purchasing opening inventory

-Purchasing fixtures, furniture, and other miscellaneous equipment

 

                               

REWARDS

 

$1 - You will receive a special shout out on Facebook and/or Twitter. Be sure to enter your Twitter and/or Facebook name if you have an account.

 

$25 - Special shout out on Facebook and/or Twitter, in addition to a personalized Uplifting Thank You card. Be sure to add your mailing address.

 

$75 - Special shout out on Facebook and/or Twitter, a personalized Uplifting Thank You card, and a $10 off coupon. Be sure to add your mailing address.

 

$100 - Special shout out on Facebook and/or Twitter, a personalized Uplifting Thank You card, a $10 off coupon, and an Uplifting tote. Be sure to add your mailing address.

 

$500 - Special shout out on Facebook and/or Twitter, a personalized Uplifting Thank You card, a $10 off coupon, an Uplifting tote, and a free bra. Be sure to enter your bra size, style preference, and mailing address.

 

$1000 - Special shout out on Facebook and/or Twitter, a personalized Uplifting Thank You card, a $10 off coupon, an Uplifting tote, a free bra, and a special invite to a sneak peak of Uplifting and the opportunity to shop prior to the grand opening to the public.

                                   

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, you can contribute by spreading the word. Share this campaign with family, friends, associates, coworkers, etc. Just tell them to go to www.indiegogo.com/upliftingbra and check out the campaign!

story:
THE OUTLINE OF THE PROJECT

Is the bar/pub, intended as a social space, still a reflection of society as a whole?

These remote corners of the world treasure thousands of stories that we can use to trace the story of a country.

BaRuta's aim it to produce a small guide that wil convey, through the images and stories that can be found behind and within Southamerican bars, the various aspects of three Latin American countries: Argentina, Chile and Bolivia.

A further aspect will be that our guide is speaks to the traveller that thinks outside the box: for those who are in search of the authentic South America, are willing to be captured by the words of the inhabitants and don't want to follow the perspective of a fellow tourist.

HOW?  

What we (Margherita and Silvia) have intention of doing is to prepare our backpack for a 4 month tour in search of the hidden and characteristic/typical bars of the above-mentioned countries,avoiding those recommended by travel guides. The result will be a total of 60 bars, reviewed by clients and by the bartenders, and accompanied by photos depicting spaces and the people that inhabit them. For every bar we will attach three artistic photos: one wide-angle photo of the space, a detail of the bar of our choice and a black and white portrait of one loyal customes; on the side you will find the direct speech of one of the clients or of the bartenders himself.

WITH YOUR HELP

We will have the chance of travelling across the southamerican continent, exploring bars and interviewing and getting to know interesting people that will tell us their stories and everything about their products.

The funds we will be able to garner will be used for the necessary photographic equipment (camera not included), transportation, film, accomodation (low budget), paper, print and binding of the first self produced copies of the guide.

OTHER WAYS

We are aware that not everyone, even if passionate, can support our cause economically, but if you are interested, you can post our explanatory clip on social media like facebook, twitter, indiegogo so as to reach all of your contacts. Don't forget to pass the word!

story:
Hello,

My family and I are really wanting to get into farming.  There is nothing better then going home at night knowing you worked hard for your family on something you own together.

We are trying to get financed to put up a large scale egg laying barn.  To do a construction project this big we need start-up money to pay on the interest of the loan and normal monthly cost until the barn starts paying for itself. 

So the funding we are trying to obtain here will help pay some of the cost while still providing for my family.

We are looking at this as a business that will provide for our family for generations to come. 

Please help us provide a better life for our family.

story:
George and his dream of 'African Track & Trails Adventures', needs your help!


My name is Stefanie and I have made it my goal to help George realise his dream of starting his own Tour Company. Due to an injury and the following medical costs, George has no funds of his own to finally start his small business. I am currently a Field Guide in training and am thus not having an income to help him financially. But let me start from the beginning …
This is George.

George, 34 years, is a tour guide operator with more than 10 years of immense experience in the tourism industry and has been rated as one of the best guides in Namibia on TripAdvisor. Jenny Shipley, the former Prime Minister of New Zealand was one of George's 'clients' and he was her guide for the filming of Intrepid Journeys. If you have ever travelled to Namibia and around with Wild Dog Safaris, you might know George!

George with Jenny Shipley, former Prime Minister of New Zealand (photo source: www.namibiankids.org.nz)


George is very passionate about tourism and showing clients the beauty of his country. Starting his own company is his dream and would be a massive step in his career. It would give him the chance to offer his services and experience to the tourism industry in a more creative, personal way. This he cannot currently achieve.
George has already started with the registration and compliance process but needs serious funding to complete this process and start operations of his Track & Trail Adventure Company.

As someone who had the pleasure to have George as a guide, I can assure you that you won't find a better one to explain and show you the beauty of Namibia's nature. Rather than spending many hours on the road, his tours will bring you to places like the famous Fish River Canyon on foot so you experience Africa in its most personal way. 


Get George started and get rewarded! Every Dollar helps, Thank you!

For George to get the company up and running with everything included, 1.5 Million Namibian Dollars are needed. With this amount of money the following will be funded
  • Registration and licensing process
  • purchase of minibus and trailer
  • insurance cover
  • office space with necessary equipments
  • start of marketing process
  • camping equipment for 10 people max. 
  • other expenses


Literally every Dollar helps and will bring George forward with his dream. Whether you can spare 5$ or 100$ or more – any kind of donation is greatly appreciated so a big THANK YOU already to all the future funders of African Track & Trail Adventures!
Should we not reach our goal of 130'000 US$ then know that we will be immensely grateful for the funds raised and they will be invested in buying a minibus. This way George can start with a shuttle and transport service to generate income and to further develop the business idea.


Namibia on foot

Namibia is an incredible country with so many different landscape types and vast land that wants to be explored. Instead of spending hours in a bus to drive from A to B and spend only short amounts of time in a certain place, African Track & Trail Adventures will focus more on exploring nature on foot. Walk the Fish River Canyon with a backpack, binoculars and your camera and then camp under the stars or sleep in accommodations. You choose! The size of the group will be limited to provide the best possible experience for everyone. 


Up for a challenge …

Namibia's Tourism Industry is big and the challenge will be to make room for 'another' tour operator. However I am confident that George will find his way to one of the top tour operators as he has the experience, the connections and the necessary knowledge to tackle these challenges. After all there are plenty of tour operators that offer tours in a bus but George will offer tours on foot and with transport in between …


Please help George any way you can!

If you can't contribute with money, you can still contribute with time!

  • Help spread the word and tell all your friends and family and so on 
  • Help share on Social Media and anywhere else you can
  • Let us know if I haven't covered something that is important for you to know so I can add it to the campaign

Go George! Go Namibia!!

story:
Short Summary

PhilanthrApparel is an organization that makes contributions to society not as a whim but as a way of life that fulfills our purpose. No matter how small your impact, together, we will help the world.

My name is Jordan Bates, I graduated from Florida State University and started working a job I hated. I was successful, but I found out that their tactics didn't align with my ethics. I've been searching for the purpose of my life all throughout college and I've finally found it. It was a sudden "ah hah" moment of realization that once I discovered it I could not do anything else except start PhilanthrApparel.

I've always enjoyed volunteering and I knew someday I wanted to donate as much money as I could to charity, but couldn't afford to, as I was a broke college student. "Someday" I would tell myself, someday I would make enough money to donate. I found myself making small purchases in which a percentage would go to a quality charity I cared about whenever I could (which was scarce.) I would sport the merchandise around town and love the conversations that were started as a result of my apparel. My life has been surrounded by death as of late, and it has sparked a sense of urgency in my life. I feel as though if I don't do this before I die, it will be one of my only regrets. 

As I'm sure you're aware, starting a company is expensive and I'm now only a less-broke college graduate. However since I've started working on this company, everyday has been the best day of my life. I want to bring my passion for contributing to the world today because tomorrow may never come.

What We Need & What You Get

$5,000 would be enough to produce enough product and to start selling at a small profit after the 15% to charity. If we do not reach this goal we will drain our personal assets, sink into debt and live like monks (literally.) 

$10= a personalized Facebook shout-out! 

$15= a handwritten letter from yours truly

$20= an "I <3 Phil" sticker

$30= a limited edition  Phil Founder T-shirt

The Impact

There are many great charities out there who don't receive much attention. We are here to connect great people with those great charities in a fashionable way.

Anyone who has discovered their purpose in life knows how terrifying it is to actually go for it. Those who don't know, keep searching, you will find it one day and the world will come together just as I hope it does for me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please: like our Facebook page then share it with your friends, follow us on Twitter, Intagram and Google+ all of which can be found on our website PhilanthrApparel.com

story:
For the last 7 years, we have had the privilege of going to downtown to help keep the homeless warm through the winter.  What once started as blankets quickly evolved into sleeping bags to better meet the needs of those living without any shelter.  Every year we have gone down with more sleeping bags than the previous, and every year, within 20 minutes of having started, we are left standing next to an empty trailer, heartbroken to have to turn people away.

            There is no agenda, this isn’t a publicity stunt to gain church members; in fact the distance from the downtown area to our church pretty much insures none of the sleeping bag recipients will show up on Sunday.  We simply want to let people in our neighborhoods and cities know they are loved, to meet physical needs, to be a compassionate ear, to show a vague, human representation of how God loves you, me, homeless people.

            On November 19 we will load up our trailer and drive to downtown , to a city block where hundreds of homeless are gathered, where we can park and start handing out sleeping bags to anyone who wants one; our goal is to have 500 sleeping bags in our trailer that day that can be freely given.  For the last couple years, we have discovered Wal-Mart sells a sleeping bag for $10.80 including tax; and every single penny will go towards the purchase of a sleeping bag.  Last year we collected over 250 sleeping bags, solely from people in our church and believe we can easily reach our 500 sleeping bag goal with your generous gifts - in fact - we hope to far surpass that number.

           Please email if you have any questions.  Jared@vineyardanthem.com.

Thank you!

story:
Chipstead is an active village and our current playground is a focal point for families to meet up and have fun. It is very well used by the children in the village and those attending the local primary school, but the playground is 24 years old and does not cater well for children under the age of 5, or over the age of 7. The proposed playground will be within the same footprint and offers an exciting area for children aged 7-11 and a more age-appropriate area for those under 5. It blends traditional and dynamic modern play equipment in a more stream-lined look which better suits its rural environment. 

We are delighted that this exciting project is supported and welcomed by Chevening Parish Council. 


-- Thank you to all who have already supported this campaign!! We greatly appreciate your generosity.  Trish, Jayne and the Team

story:
The Creighton Model FertilityCare™ System (CrMS) identifies and treats  women's health issues like Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS), Infertility, Endometriosis, PMS, and Premenopause to name a few. Most women don't know about this method and struggle for years trying to understand what's going on with their body.

By introducing this campaign, it will raise the much needed funding  to inform and educate women about the CrMS, bring hope to those women who are having trouble conceiving or just want answers to their health issues, and finally, train those who can specialize in educating women and couples in The Creighton Model FertilityCare™ System.

What We Need and What You Get

We need the funding to certify fertility care practitioners to meet the growing demand for Fertility Awareness in the Nashville and Clarksville area.

Our goal is to reach $50,000.00 by the end of the campaign.  75% of the funds  will provide training for five educators, while 25% will provide promotional and educational materials to get the word out regarding the program and the options available through the program.

Every dollar helps! For every dollar given up to $50, a thank you note along with a social media acknowledgement will be given. For every donation over $50.00, a complementary Introductory Session (for yourself or someone you know) and a social media acknowledgement will be given. And, for every donation over $100.00, we will give you a shout out on social media and your name will appear on the training program in a special section labeled "With Your Support, We Thank You" in January 2015.

If we do not reach our total goal, then any monies received will contribute to the training that will be held in January 2015.

    By getting involved and/or donating you will make a profound impact for women's health locally, nationally, and globally. 

    Risks & Challenges

    A major risk if adequate funding is not raised is the tragedy of silence that will stunt the growth of fully understanding and embracing women's health.

    The challenge is to create opportunities for open and honest conversation on current uses of healing and to empower women to make their own well-informed health choices. 

    As a nurse for over 20 years, I offer real hope and natural solutions to your menstrual cycles along with a 98.6% effective rate in avoiding pregnancy and (by the 3rd cycle) a 90% effective rate for achieving pregnancy through The Creighton Model FertilityCare™ System. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Every dollar counts no matter what the amount! If you are unable to give at this time, that's okay! You can still be involved in big ways. Please pass our mission along to your friends, neighbors, and coworkers to get them involved too. Copy this URL:  http://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/b396e6... and post this campaign on your Facebook page or through Twitter. Give us a shout out so others who also want to be a part of what we're doing here can learn more about how to get involved. 

      Thank You! We couldn't do this without you!

story:
Summary

At Walt Disney Animation Studios, making movies isn't always all magic and fairy dust.  Production can be an uphill challenge with demanding deadlines - our latest film, "Big Hero 6", is no exception.  

Like any other job, during crunch, person hygiene can become a lower priority.  In the case of Steve and Shant - they have taken it to a new extreme. 

Why We Need Your Help

Steve and Shant have come to enjoy their overgrown mane, but fail to realize their culmination of big hair has become a distraction and challenge to everyday activity. 

With the completion of "Big Hero 6", Steve and Shant have grown overly comfortable avoiding hair cuts and beard trims, and we need your help to relieve them of this burden and groom them back in shape. 

What We Plan To Do About It

Steve and Shant have agreed to cut their hair, if our fundraising goal is met by the time "Big Hero 6" opens in theaters November 7, 2014 (fundraising ends November 5).

Each contributor enters for the opportunity to design the hairdo which Steve and Shant will wear for a day (to be announced November 6).

The Benefit 

Proceeds will be donated to the Ryder Buck Memorial Scholarship Fund, something very close to our hearts at the studio.

story:
Ales for the Unrooted.

Transplants Brewing Company is getting ready to launch and we need your help! We are a brewery focused on west coast hoppy ales and creative specialties opening in the beautiful city of Palmdale, CA in Summer 2015. Just as Los Angeles attracts and collects random people from all over the world (our team originally hails from Chicago and New York), our specialty beer recipes draw from diverse, worldly and ethnic influences which often blur the lines between culinary and brewing sensibilities. In both senses, Transplants Brewing Company truly is Ales for the Unrooted.


Our Story so Far.

Brewers Sarah and Matthew Luker were first introduced to brewing by their neighbor Charles and took a quick interest in working out inventive concepts and ideas together. Since then, we have been constantly refining recipes while racking up consistent homebrew awards with our non-traditional specialty beers that include such creations as Filbert, a Chocolate Hazelnut Brown ale and Spruce Moose, a Cascadian Dark Ale brewed with molasses and spruce tips. With our membership and active participation in both BEAVR and Yeastside Brewers homebrew clubs, we've surrounded ourselves with a great crowd of supportive and talented brewers who we continue to learn from and grow with. 

After winning Best in Show in the AV fair in 2013 and brewing a ridiculously hoppy IPA collaboration "Plant Trance" with our friends at Bravery Brewing, we were inspired and determined to have a place of our own. After discovering we had a similar vision for opening a brewery as contest founder and brewery special projects coordinator Corey Cordovano, we teamed up, joined forces and started planning together as things began to take shape.

Brew Dogs: Craft Beer Virgins LA.

In March 2014 Sarah and Matt celebrated their ten year wedding anniversary via an epic two week craft beer tour of Oregon and Washington, returning more inspired and motivated than ever to move our brewing vision forward. The very day we got back we received an unexpected follow up call from an audition the month before. We raced down to a sculpture class in Culver City with whatever bottles we had available to end up having our S'mores Porter served in an unaired Craft Beer Virgins segment of the Los Angeles Brew Dogs episode, now available for your viewing enjoyment. We were thrilled to be able to share our beers and hear such positive feedback from Martin, James and crew, as well as the sculptors trying them who didn’t realize at the time that we were outside listening. In a city that they referred to as the homebrew capital of the world, we're proud that they considered our beers amongst their favorites. 

A Place to Call Home.

After months of searching for appropriate locations and trying to find a city that really wanted us there, we were fortunate enough to find the perfect location in Palmdale, CA. With 7000 square feet of space, our location has plenty of room to support the 10bbl brewhouse we’re installing, plus still have plenty of room leftover for our planned barrel aging projects and of course a large tasting room. The city of Palmdale has been completely encouraging and helpful throughout the entire process and we are thrilled to be their very first brewery.


So here's the deal.

Our brewery space is secured and our equipment will soon be in production. As costs continue to add up, we are looking for your help to raise $20,000 to install the walk-in cold room and surrounding bar. The cold room will directly feed the taps at the bar as well as provide additional keg storage, and the bar will be some of the prime seating in our tasting room, given its proximity to the beer being served. 

This is your chance to be a part of building the brewery and helping us make this happen. The perks we are offering are one time only deals for initial supporters that will never be offered again. By contributing to this campaign, you will be supporting the launch of a truly unique voice in the brewing industry that is bringing interesting and fresh ideas that really deliver. (Please note that all perks are only redeemable in person at our tasting room and are not transferable)

Please help us spread the word!

Please share, post, email, and tell anyone that might be interested about our campaign. We can all agree that the world needs more quality craft beer, so even if you can’t contribute please tell somebody else to help us spread the word.

Thanks for your support!

This is your chance to be a part of building the brewery and helping us make this happen. The perks we are offering are one time only deals for initial supporters that will never be offered again. By contributing to this campaign, you will be supporting the launch of a truly unique voice in the brewing industry that is bringing interesting and fresh ideas that really deliver. (Please note that all perks are only redeemable in person at our tasting room and are not transferable)
Please help us spread the word!
Please share, post, email, and tell anyone that might be interested about our campaign. We
can all agree that the world needs more quality craft beer, so even if you can’t
contribute please tell somebody else to help us spread the word.
Thanks for your support!

story:
The Center for Civic Innovation serves as a home for conversations, experimentation, and action around social opportunities and challenges in the city of Atlanta


The Center was recently awarded as “People’s Choice” through the Points of Light Civic Accelerator Demo Night at the World of Coke in Atlanta.


What is the Center for Civic Innovation?


The Center for Civic Innovation is a 7,500 square foot space and is a resource hub and open campus for social entrepreneurs and changemakers. Located in the heart of downtown Atlanta in the M.Rich Building, the Center’s work focuses on supporting and investing in ideas that improve the service delivery and efficiency of public organizations and finding new ways to engage local communities in decision making on the future of the city. The Center empowers the local community to take charge of the future of their city. 


What Does the Center Do?


On a day to day basis, the Center is home to events, trainings, and convenings that engage local communities, accelerate innovative ideas, and push for stronger local policies. We believe that the best solutions to civic challenges come from collective community impact-- when public organizations, local governments, corporations, and community members work together to problem solve. We particularly see civic engagement as a fundamental component for success.

The Center for Civic Innovation runs "civic labs" that bring together leaders and stakeholders across sectors, including government agencies, nonprofits, business, and academia. The civic labs will yield ideas on cutting costs or generating new revenue for public organizations and initiatives, increasing participation in city decision making, and promoting policies that open up the innovation economy in Atlanta. The Center's first pilot civic lab will be in partnership with the Atlanta Community Food Bank (ACFB) around the issue of "food access."
In addition to the civic labs, the Center will host co-working and office space for social enterprises. The Center will support them with resources to grow and succeed. There is also a 3,500 square foot event space for events and workshops.

If you are interested in working out of the Center, either in our co-working space or by renting an office suite, check out: www.civicatlanta.org


Our First Pilot with the Atlanta Community Food Bank

Throughout the month of October, the Center will bring together food agencies for a roundtable conversation around challenges they face and those challenges will be issued to creative civic hackers. The Center will invest in the best solutions, guide the implementation process, and measure impact. Simultaneously, the Center will run a creative campaign to educate the local community about the issue of food access and will host a series of events and panels for the community to participate. This pilot will help inform a methodology that can be adopted across issue areas in the coming future.

Who Are We? 

The Center for Civic Innovation is supported by a local Atlanta Civic Innovation Council made up of community leaders in Atlanta across industries. The council works with community partner agencies, nonprofits and corporations to develop comprehensive campaigns around specific local challenges. The Center will build a network of individual and corporate members that will drive the activities of the Center.


What Will My Contribution Be Used For?

Your contribution will be used to fund our pilot program with the Atlanta Community Food Bank. Details above. This will be a fundamental opportunity for us to prove out our model and make us competitive for future grant dollars. Thank you so much for your support.

story:
Every year in San Francisco social entrepreneurs, impact investors, and thought leaders from around the world come together to unite the social enterprise sector at the SOCAP conference. Entrepreneurs building businesses to alleviate poverty need your help to attend. Help them by donating to the Impact Squared Campaign! 

The Problem

The Social Capital Markets Conference (SOCAP) provides worthy entrepreneurs with valuable scholarships  that covers the costs of their SOCAP pass and housing during the conference. At SOCAP, entrepreneurs have the opportunity meet with investors who can help them grow their business to serve more people, network with potential partners and peers; and to learn about new advances in social entrepreneurship. 

There's just one problem -- to take advantage of all these opportunities, the entrepreneurs  need to get to San Francisco! Flight tickets to SF from different parts of Africa cost much more then the social entrepreneurs can spare from their shoestring budgets! 


The Solution 

Together we will offset the airfare costs for 6 Global Social Benefit Institute (GSBI) alumni who have received SOCAP14 scholarships. Your donations will go directly to reimburse the tickets of these amazing entrepreneurs. 

Your donation has impact far beyond physical transportation. These five leaders provide clean energy, jobs, healthcare and education to the base of the pyramid everyday. By helping these entrepreneurs meet investors and experts in the field they will be equipped to reach more people and SQUARE YOUR IMPACT! 

                                        

The Entrepreneurs

Their bags are packed they are ready to go. Meet the entrepreneurs who are trying to get to SOCAP.   


David Gerard - Green Bio Energy Ltd - Uganda
Green Bio Energy is working in Uganda making organic charcoal briquettes out of charcoal dust, organic waste and agricultural residue. The value chain is all local: the production equipment has been designed and manufactured locally making it a Ugandan product for Ugandans.

Galen Welsch- Jibu- Uganda 

Jibu blankets underserved populations with drinking water franchises about 2 km  apart so every community has convenient, affordable access to drinkable water. 


Rik Stamhuis - Jiro-Ve - Madagascar

 Jiro-Ve provides energy to off the grid communities in Madagascar. By supplying clean energy lights to rural communities Jiro-Ve has empowered the people of Madagascar. To date Jiro-Ve has reached over 7,500 people across Madagascar.


Tania Laden - LivelyHoods - Kenya 

LivelyHoods taps the power of high potential youth in urban Kenyan slums to create economic opportunities. They create jobs, give slum consumers access to life-changing products, and assist companies to penetrate hard-to-reach markets. To date LivelyHoods has reached over 10,000 households in Kenya.


Keneth Ndua - STAMP Investments - Kenya

STAMP developed the Energy Conserving Stove (ECOS), a fuel-efficient biomass stove featuring an innovative built-in jacket that can be filled with 7 liters of water. This feature insulates the stove, making it both more energy efficient and allowing the user to simultaneously boil water whilst cooking. The value chain is all local too! The production, distribution and marketing are all based in Kenya.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your family, friends, coworkers, acquaintances, pen-pals, arch-enemies, ex-spouses, stepmother, bowling partner, drinking buddies and dentist to share this link to everyone!

story:
Ukraine-based, out-sourced programming. 

Ukraine produces some of the best technologists in the world. From its soviet-era past wherein the country trained and provided the USSR with computer experts for the military, aerospace, manufacturing and transportation industries, Ukraine's expertise continues. These vocational and educational infrastructures are still in place today.

The country is recognized in the IT community for the level of expert training its many universities and colleges provide. 

Due to the continual political and economic unrest the country has undergone since the breakup of the Soviet Union, and the heightened sense of uncertainty that has dominated the lives of Ukrainians since the Maidan protests, many of these highly-skilled programmers are either unemployed or are having to work more than one job in order to make ends meet.

What makes us unique from other out-sourcing providers is our commitment to Ukraine. We contract only Ukrainian programmers.

Code-Aid provides a service whereby these experts can register with our agency and be linked with European and North American companies that require their particular programming expertise on a per project, out-sourced basis. 

Through our contacts at the various levels of government and at the schools of technology, we already have access to these experts. Through the support of contributors such as yourself, we will provide them with a method of augmenting their income and in many cases, provide them with an excellent primary income. 

We already have multilingual support and sales staff in place in Ukraine. All monies pledged will be used to further cultivate our contractor and customer networks and complete the construction of our website.

Of course the biggest risk to the success of this project is the state of civil war that is currently taking place in Ukraine. In spite of this situation, bills still need to be paid; the landlord still wants his rent. The lives of the people of Ukraine continue. Work must still be done. 

Governments promise aid. We, as individuals, have an opportunity to make immediate change. Your contribution allows us to get our company working NOW.

How can you help?

  • Contribute if you can. 
  • Follow us on Twitter and re-tweet our postings.
  • Tell your friends and colleagues about us. 
  • Please answer this call to action.

Ukraine will rebuild. Code-Aid intends to play a part, albeit a small part, in the process. Your contribution can change someone's life.

story:
Save Granny’s House - Community Picnic

709 N Evers Plant City Florida Built 1914

It was awful, every family’s nightmare. In 2004 a fire ravaged Granny and Grandad’s house. The pesky kitchen fire did its worst to level the house but the family dog Lillie (a sweet and foul tempered Pomerania) was determined to save the day.  It was her ever present vigilance in making sure everyone knew she was under foot that alerted the family to the fire. The family had spent 19 years of love and family time renovating the home. 

*Kitchen Sink After the Fire
Kitchen grease fires are the worst and Lillie knew this. And as she goes running through the house with Granny’s son hot on her trail the family is now warned that the kitchen is on fire. Panic and mayhem explode and so does the kitchen. By this point the stove is a goner and the flames are starting to creep up the 100 year old walls. Grandad had lovingly restored those walls and had diligently marked the door jamb next to the stove with all the grandchildren’s heights. Eight grandchildren in total and the occasional adult who wanted to get in on the fun had all measure up next to that jamb. It too is now a goner with only photos and memories to fill Granny’s thoughts.

*Kitchen Before the Fire - Still Mostly Vintage 1914
And to make it worse, Granny and Grandad were out of town. You see, it was their 50th wedding anniversary trip and they had gone up to Alaska to celebrate. Son was house sitting for them and that is when the possessed kitchen fire took its chance to attack the house. We all know that kitchen fires are always looking for a chance to escape the kitchen and go explore the house. Unfortunately, as they explore they leave a mass of charred memories behind.

With no time to lose Granny’s son goes tearing out of the house and starts banging on neighbors doors. Fire, Fire, he yells. Eventually a neighbor takes notice and the fire trucks are on the way. But the pesky fire had been planning this for a long time. You see, the city had recently turned the hydrants off for cleaning so no water was available to fight the fire. This prolonged the fires life and allowed it to explore all the way up to the second floor.

*Earlier That Year Grandpa had Rebuilt the Kitchen Sink
Granny’s house fought back. It stopped the flames in the closest of the master bed room but in the mayhem the fire breached the wall and the roof. This would usually spell the end for a grand old house but she kept fighting. She fought hard and with the old stately glory that only an old historic home can muster. Even when the fire became so hot all the windows on the lower level shattered she fought on. When the smoke was so thick that all the original oak and cypress paneling oozed sap and burst into flames, she kept fighting. But it was the smoke and the heat that finished her off. She could fight the fire with the help of the dedicated firefighters but the heat and the smoke gutted the house.

* Before the Fire With Spring Flowers

We all spent weeks shoveling charred remnants of Granny and Grandpa’s life out of that house and if you have never experienced the angst that comes from loading a large dumpster with family treasures and memories I hope you never do. Shovel after shovel full of charred soggy history was hauled out of the house. And after all the burned and stained furniture went it was now the houses turn to suffer. You see we had to strip the walls back to the studs, no wires, no pipes, and glorious paneling. 

* After the Fire all Boarded Up
It is all gone. Granny lost it all. The home and all her belongings burnt and tossed in the dumpster. What was saved was the computer and Granny being of the techie type she had just recently transferred all her photos on to her computer's hard drive. We were able to save that. She still has her pictures and no one was hurt. Today she and Lillie spend their time telling old stories and cooking up some of the best chicken and dumplings you have ever had. Personally I am fond of the pound cake and that is what I am hoping is in the goodie bags.

Please help Granny and Grandad save the house. We as her children, their spouses, and adult grandchildren just can’t help to the level that this home needs. Our plan is to rebuild the house and have the youngest daughter live there and to serve as the special place the family can gather for holidays and events. Granny and Grandad are getting up in their years and have trouble with the stairs but Granny and Grandpa’s final dream is to see this home continue forward for the next generation. To raise their children and provide the love that only a Granny can give.

*After the Fire - Flames Exploded out the Walls
I know this is a sad story but it must be told. Some of you will question the truth of the story so to make certain there is no question about the validity of the grand old house I have included lots of before and after pictures. Also, here is a link to Google Maps that shows the home as it sits today.

https://www.google.com/maps/@28.0210448,-82.1247764,3a,75y,263.43h,83.06t/data=!3m4!1e1!3m2!1sNil6pyfJHjWUE54B5-Z0hg!2e0

* Before the Fire - The Fireplace Front had Been Rebuilt
Time is important for us. You see the home has sat vacant for the last ten years without repair and the City wants to demolish it. This is how life goes and we can accept life’s changes but to give one last effort to the saving of Granny’s house we need money. Not for some crazy new tech product, not for some new music project, but for something old. Something old like memories, the memories of your Granny and how she would feel if you were able to save her house so that she could know her legacy was able to be passed down to the next generation. The old memories of Christmas morning watching all the children open presents. The old memories of listening to the house creak during stormy nights and the old memories of you and your friends growing to adulthood and remembering Granny’s house.

* Mantel After the Fire
****Update*****
11/3/14
The city is still trying to demolish the home. In the event that the home is removed the intent for any raised funds will be to cover any existing liens on the property due to demolition. We were at the city council meeting last week and are working to put all the pieces together for renovation. 

Also,  In the event that the full $75,000 is not raised, any funds in this account will be used to assist with liens and repairs as dictated by the city,  The property is still owned by my inlaws and has value with the lot and large back shop.

story:
Our Story

The Walnut Hills Fellowship is all about building lasting friendships with people.  Thirty caring people have relocated to a crummy part of Cincinnati to love the poor.  We live in a neighborhood where drugs are abused, education is sub-par, and many dads are absent.  Before the age of 7, Cory has already seen his dad strung out on drugs, Devin has never seen his dad, and Michael just saw his mom for the first time in a long while after she was released from jail.  We are here to love these kids and their parents.  We go into their turf (school, home, stores), and we love hard.  We encourage academic success through rigorous first grade interventions and we become surrogate families for our most vulnerable neighbors.


The Impact

Over the past 4 years, we have worked in this manner with over 10 families.  We cannot measure the value of these relationships with numbers, but we can tell you that we are making space for authentic relationships to happen. Cory and his mother have friends that will listen to their frustrations and advocate for them, Devin and his mother have more than 30 folks who can help relieve the stress of a single-parent family, and Michael and his mother know they will have support as they learn to live together again. We are so thankful for these friendships, but there are so many other similar stories we are learning about every day. 


We need your help to expand this work into the lives of 5 more families over the next 4 months.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to support the coordination of this work, we need $10,000 to provide a salary for Adam Hayden [aka MC (Till)]. This will help offset the expenses of rent, food, diapers, and other essentials. (Note: If we don't reach our goal, rest assured that Adam's daughter will still have diapers!) Often, when people raise salaries for non-profit work, they go to a few really wealthy individuals for a large amount of money.  That’s great.  We think wealthy philanthropists play an incredible role in our society, and we thank them.  Where does that leave the individual who is not as wealthy though?  We want to go to large amounts of people for just a few dollars.  (Although we certainly don't turn away larger amounts:) 
Will you consider being a partner in this work?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help get the word out about this by clicking on the share tools. Let your Facebook friends know about the awesome work being done at the Walnut Hills Fellowship.
story_txt:
Our Story
The Walnut Hills Fellowship is all about building lasting friendships with people.  Thirty caring people have relocated to a crummy part of Cincinnati to love the poor.  We live in a neighborhood where drugs are abused, education is sub-par, and many dads are absent.  Before the age of 7, Cory has already seen his dad strung out on drugs, Devin has never seen his dad, and Michael just saw his mom for the first time in a long while after she was released from jail.  We are here to love these kids and their parents.  We go into their turf (school, home, stores), and we love hard.  We encourage academic success through rigorous first grade interventions and we become surrogate families for our most vulnerable neighbors.

The Impact

Over the past 4 years, we have worked in this manner with over 10 families.  We cannot measure the value of these relationships with numbers, but we can tell you that we are making space for authentic relationships to happen. Cory and his mother have friends that will listen to their frustrations and advocate for them, Devin and his mother have more than 30 folks who can help relieve the stress of a single-parent family, and Michael and his mother know they will have support as they learn to live together again. We are so thankful for these friendships, but there are so many other similar stories we are learning about every day. 

We need your help to expand this work into the lives of 5 more families over the next 4 months.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to support the coordination of this work, we need $10,000 to provide a salary for Adam Hayden [aka MC (Till)]. This will help offset the expenses of rent, food, diapers, and other essentials. (Note: If we don't reach our goal, rest assured that Adam's daughter will still have diapers!) Often, when people raise salaries for non-profit work, they go to a few really wealthy individuals for a large amount of money.  That’s great.  We think wealthy philanthropists play an incredible role in our society, and we thank them.  Where does that leave the individual who is not as wealthy though?  We want to go to large amounts of people for just a few dollars.  (Although we certainly don't turn away larger amounts:) Will you consider being a partner in this work?

 
Other Ways You Can Help
You can help get the word out about this by clicking on the share tools. Let your Facebook friends know about the awesome work being done at the Walnut Hills Fellowship.

story:
About the Lab

Makers Lab, is a Washington, DC based event design firm that builds and supports queer communities by creating spaces that celebrate life, art and culture. In September 2014 we will launch a slate of exciting concepts and collaborations, many of which will become monthly events. Plus, we will produce new events as ideas emerge! Check out our upcoming events:

September

  • Vow of Silence: Baltimore Screening \\ Collaboration with Fatback Films
  • Q(Weird)o & Zami Present: Tha Nobodys
  • Disfunktion: An Old School Dance Party

October

  • Get Funky: Body Positive Workout Dance Party featuring Live DJ & Juice Bar
  • Taste of Honey: Art & Music Showcase \\ Collaboration with Cocoa Couch Collective

November

  • Popcorn & Queers: Movie Night Highlighting LGBT Filmmakers
  • Quellness Workshop: Thrive Through the Holidays
  • Toquirky: A Q(Weird)o Thanksgiving Potluck
December
    • Holi(day) Party: Celebrate the Holidays Makers Lab Style

    February

    • Spice Night: A Singles Mixer
    • Audre Lorde Birthday Celebration: A Night of Storytelling, Activism & Community

    April 

    • Honey Groove: Art & Music Festival Celebrating Queer Women of Color Collaboration with Cocoa Couch Collective
    • NCAA Women's Final Four Watch Party

    May

    • State of the Lab 
    • District of Queer Launch
    • Black Pride Festivities

    These events NEED to happen but we need your support! Together we can build something special. ANY amount you contribute is greatly appreciated. We have some awesome perks including magnets, pint glasses and mugs, t-shirts and tickets to our events.

    The Lab Needs YOU

    Makers Lab needs $25,000 to make magic. We have three goals for the funds we’re raising:

    1)   $18,000 - Event Production & Event Accessibility  
          We are producing some great events! A majority of your contributions will go to         space rental, compensating artists and presenters and making sure our events         can remain affordable and accessible.

    2)   $5,000 - District of Queer Website 
           Makers Lab wants to create space online and offline! In addition to events, we            are creating District of Queer - a hyperlocal, online community that includes              news and profiles about QTPOC artists, activists and creatives and highlights              events, workshops and happenings in the DC area.

    3)   $2,000 - Miscellaneous Expenses
                We've invested in a logo, website and business incorporation. There are,                       however, additional expenses including rent at Impact Hub DC. Impact Hub               provides space and a supportive community for people working on solutions to         our social and environmental challenges.  

    Other Ways to Support 

    There are lots of ways to support Makers Lab! Please consider:

    • Sharing this project with your family, friends and network
    • Encouraging others to contribute
    • Liking us on Facebook and following us on Twitter
    • Attending our events

    Additional Info

    Makers Lab was founded in March 2014 by Alissa Hall Perine, a queer project manager, event planner and buttonmaker. Alissa loves bringing people together and has been planning events for 10+ years. Her previous company lovebus events & design was voted "Best GLBT Wedding Planner" in the Washington City Paper Reader's Poll. She is also a co-creator of freak OUT DC , a tea dance/day party held during DC Black Pride. Makers Lab is her opportunity to collaborate with amazing people and continue her passion of building community and creating connections. 

    Video

    Videography and editing: Be Steadwell 
    Music: Pulshar "She's Got a Ticket"  & Le1f "☼‿☼ Roman "I-69"

    Questions 
    We are happy to answer any questions about Makers Lab. Please email us at hello@makerslabdc.co and we will respond within 48 hours. Also, drop us line if you are interested in potential collaborations.


    Thank You!

story:
HELP OUR SOLDIERS

•  Frustrated about the situation in Israel and wondering what you can do?

•  We are a small group of volunteers who tries to help the soldiers in the little things that will make their life easier but that tend to fall/slip through the cracks

•  Foot creams and special blister plasters so they can continue to march.

•  Eye drops to wipe their sore eyes from the sand.

•  Wet wipes so they can see and feel human again.

The small things that will make their job easier and feel valued.

We know that they are many organizations that are already sending packages to the front but after asking a couple of soldiers in the field what items they were missing the most we compiled this list.

A list of small things that still doesn't get addressed by other organizations and that make a huge difference in combat. 

Our goal is to reach 100.000$ in 5 days. Each package costs 18$ chai.

Please help us reach our goal and our soldiers and pass this on to your friends, neighbors and community. 

Show them your love and say Thank You !

story:
Short Summary

Few things matter more for families, anywhere in the world, than adequate housing and community. And few organizations are able to build both of these things with such success and heart as Habitat for Humanity. 

From September 20-28, Christa and Jess are thrilled to be heading to El Salvador as a Habitat for Humanity Global Volunteer - ready to support this amazing organization in a hands-on way (and feeling extremely grateful to have the experience of traveling to a new country as well).

Along with 10 other volunteers through Habitat for Humanity Portland/Metro East, we will help to build homes for families who otherwise may not be able to afford decent and affordable shelter. We'll be building earthquake-resistant houses in all stages of construction, from digging foundations to painting the houses.  We will be in the Sonsonate area, a highly agricultural region in the western part of the country. There, we will work with the families and community directly to construct these homes.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $1000 through this campaign. This money will help us to cover our program costs, which go directly to building materials and other miscellaneous costs associated with the team's trip. Thank you for your support and love!

The Impact

Although El Salvador is one of the smallest countries in Central America, it has one of the highest population densities. One in three people do not have adequate housing in El Salvador. Natural disasters such as earthquakes have damaged infrastructure and homes throughout the country.

This year, Habitat for Humanity El Salvador has already served 996 families.  Since 1992, Habitat for Humanity El Salvador has provided more than 10,300 housing solutions, providing simple, decent and affordable shelter for more than 51,500 Salvadorians. Habitat El Salvador works with the central office in San Salvador and seven regional offices.

Habitat for Humanity focuses on empowering families as they participate in the process. Families contribute directly to the construction of their homes and other homes in their community through "sweat equity." They also have a home loan they pay back in affordable payments  to Habitat for Humanity - which then goes back to the organization to continue building more homes.  Habitat for Humanity El Salvador also provides financial education and community development programs for participating communities.

Earthquake-resistant homes are made of concrete blocks and structural steel reinforcement. The roofs are made of fiber-cement sheeting, and the floors of cement brick. They have two bedrooms, a living room, a dining room and a latrine or toilet. 

Global Village volunteers may work in all stages of construction, from digging foundations to painting the houses. 

    Risks & Challenges

    This is an established organization, with an established international volunteer program. Still, any project runs the risk of unexpected costs and challenges to plans in place. Your donation will help support the project and whatever may come along as we build.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please help get the word out about Habitat for Humanity and all the amazing work this organization does around the world, as well as in your community. Also, consider volunteering for your local chapter!
