story:
Obviously not! Why? Because it’s not that easy to change old habits, right?! And who has the time to plan and organize a greener life these days anyway?

By making it easy for everybody to green-up with some cool tools we give sustainability a boost! With your contribution, you help the people to do so and therefore help this planet.

With all our passion we created RPeople, the perfect place for people who share love and care for this planet and for future generations to come. Taking Responsibility, acting with Respect to Reduce, Reuse and Recycle. We use our swarm intelligence (crowd sourcing) to make changes that count fast. We all know that we have to change our personal behavior and live greener- NOW and not in a few years! On RPeople we do it together and feel good about it!

What we offer:

  • To make your personal green-up easy, we have worked out an individual go-green program called R-Check for you. Take 10 minutes and live greener with an easy to fulfill task-list.

  • Social Network with regional R-Space: Are you tired of buying 10 green products until you’ve found the one that really fits your personal needs? Connect with eco-minded people worldwide and regional. We don’t waste time and resources; we ask, share and get what we want! Side effect: Save time and money and most of all: the planet.

  • On 8 categories we offer blogs, forums, green guides and link selections for you to profit from and to share your knowledge.

Imagine a global community of people who care about this planet and help each other living greener. A community of people who make big changes by changing more and more towards sustainability spreading positive vibes and having fun doing it! A community of people who care about what we can do rather than what we cannot do. A place in the internet where people move the world by finding help, sharing information and instead of talk and politicize, DO! Welcome to RPeople!

We want to bring more GRATITUDE, RESPECT and RESPONSIBILITY in our hearts and actions. When you live a greener live, you automatically live healthier, more cost-efficient and carrying. And who says that green living is not cool? There are so many cool green stores out there already - we just have to make it easier to find them. That’s why we also offer a shop directory where you can share the cool products you find with others.

- By contributing you participate in making this planet more sustainable and more respectful. Be a proud member of RPeople knowing and showing that you help to save this planet!

- With the green-up perks we guide you personally into a greener life! It couldn't be easier.

- You save money with our tips & tricks.

- Save time. The internet is loaded with information most of it of insufficient quality and ineffective help. RPeople concentrate on positive and effective solutions.

- You lose weight and live a healthier life

- You can surprise your beloved on Valentine’s Day with a very special gift (check out the perks)

- You can get an Easy Guide on 8 Categories with personal remarks from Vanessa on pdf – only available on Indiegogo.

CHECK OUT THE PERKS AND GET VIP GREEN-UP ASSISTANCE

Note: if you need one of those gifts for Valentines day, please let us know and we'll send it to you asap!

Funny Soap                                                             Cool eye shadow or lip balm

         

Recycling Belt                                                           Unique HandmadeTeddy

         


LET'S TAKE THE NEXT STEP IN EVOLUTION WITH RESPECT

Whether the politicians, economy or just “the others” don’t do enough to save this
planet, is not the point! As long as we, the consumers do not change our behavior and demand to gain more sustainability, nothing will change! It is still a fact that demand determines supply.The responsibility lies in our everyday action to ensure an enjoyable future for generations to come. And with love and respect, we achieve this goal together! We feel proud that we were able to create a tool that can make a difference in this world and we like to share it with you. Saving this planet should make us all feel proud because we can prove that we care!

how old is she now? It's time to make her wish come true!

This August, we put RPeople online – with no PR or Marketing. We already have over 100 members and Twitter followers who are asking for more content and activities from RPeople. How grateful and happy we are to realize that we created real assistance for others.

So here we are now, ready to take the next step and help RPeople to reach more people faster. For this purpose, we ask you for your support. To roll out RPeople we need to create more content, travel to partner-up with bloggers and partners, develop the App and make PR and Marketing. With your support, we can concentrate on going forward with RPeople so as to make green living easy and trendy for everyone.   

  • Next to the shop directory, blogs and forums, we offer a new space called the R-Space where people can assist each other regionally. It is unique and most efficient in that people can offer even more specific solutions in their very own areas. It’s time for action now! Let’s use our swarm intelligence to save this planet.
  • The R-Check is a personal milestone program that makes it very easy for everyone to live a more sustainable and healthy life – tailor made to their individual needs and pace. You receive an easy to accomplish task list
  • We focus on positive problem-solving content in a positive mindset only. We don’t waste time talking about what is not being done by others.
  • We show people that green living is a modern and trendy lifestyle in that we share our creativity and connect with trendy designers of sustainable products.
  • Everybody is invited to share and be active on RPeople – those who are already into green living and those who are just starting out.

Your support allows us to concentrate fully on making RPeople a success. So far we put our personal savings and free time into RPeople. To make RPeople spread and grow fast, we have to put 100% of our time and effort into this project. With your support we can do our best to save this planet for future generations. We are no dreamers but strong believers that people want to change and just need a helping hand, don't you?

Here are the steps we need to take to get the ball rolling

  • to create more and more content, recruit bloggers, and more
  • to improve the site’s design
  • to make PR/Marketing to gain members
  • to develop the App
  • to get partner websites/agents, and more contributors

We consider the funds we raise now as the first seed. The more we get, the faster we can get RPeople to grow. If we don’t raise our goal, we will still use the amount received for the tasks mentioned above.

What we offer in return is the creativity, knowledge, and ideas we have come upon and worked out with much care during the last few years. Check out the various perks we have come up with to show you our appreciation for your support!

If you wish to support RPeople in other ways than funding, we would appreciate the following individual contributions:

  • Become a member of RPeople today and spread the word.
  • Invite your friends to the RPeople social network
  • Create your region in the R-Space, and start to ask and answer questions.
  • Put the green shops in your area in the shop directory.

For the RPeople business we are looking for:

  • bloggers for each category on the platform
  • translators
  • web designers who help us improve design
  • anyone who spreads the word and help us to get members
  • people who put the green stores they see in the shop directory.
  • and please make use of the Indiegogo share tools to spread RPeople

THANK YOU for supporting RPeople!

Vanessa Bekk is a citizen of the United States and Switzerland. She is the creative one with education and experience in the Fine Arts. In business she discovered her passion for creating cool concepts for marketing. Her practical way of thinking and the urge to find the most efficient way to live a greener life, is what made RPeople happen in the first place. Vanessa never gets tired of finding and creating new ways and shares them with others. What best describes Vanessa: “Where there’s a will, there’s a way and don’t bore me with “it’s difficult.”

Gernot Bekk is a Styrian oak (like Arnold Schwarzenegger - just less muscles). Gernot studied information technology and economics - and now you know who programmed the RPeople site. He is well-known for creating unique marketing strategies in the business world. When he’s not thinking about what else RPeople need, he spends his time in the world of online marketing for RPeople. His passion for green living and the wish to help more people living it too drives him to extraordinary achievements. What best describes Gernot: Creative nerd or: “Do you honestly think that numbers don’t have feelings?”


Shefali is the health expert of RPeole. This Ayurvedic doctor with experience in allopathy is the person you want to have by your side in order to live a healthier life! She brings experience over 20 years into the team and looks at green living from a healthy point of view. What makes Shefali so special is that she acts with respect and includes personal life situations into lifestyle adjustments. If you ever meet her in person and start to talk about your problems, it might very well be that she gives you the answer just as if that was the most natural thing on earth. And if you think that Shefali sits in her yoga position and preaches the “better way”, you should see her at 11pm at a dinner party enjoying life – this woman knows how much fun a healthy and green life brings!


Is Bernd Sonalkar another nerd in the RPeople team? Yes! Fortunately, Bernd is what we like to call “the cool nerd”. He somehow manages to keep his genius brains on earth which makes him a very special and fun to be with member of the team. Bernd is a physicist and chemist and brings his knowledge of science into the team. Is that important for green living? Don’t even ask him this question – he won’t stop explaining until you have completely understood the importance of treating atoms the green way!

We combine technical and practical business skills in our team. Our key to success: Love and passion for RPeople and the true calling to help save this planet.

“Let’s live a more sustainable lifestyle.” we said to ourselves. What seemed easy to do turned out to be a real challenge. Let’s face it! It takes a little more effort to live a greener life than just to replace a few light bulbs. But busy people have only a little time to sit down, make detailed plans, and reorganize things. It’s time – it’s all about not having enough time.

And, yet, it is clear, our environment demands faster change – from each and every one of us. So we began searching for a solution to make green living easier to achieve.

We wrote a book. But with a book, you have to sit down and do all that planning again. “Not helpful enough!” we thought. We need a platform, a social network, a shop directory, a tailor made “go-green guide” for individuals to follow step-by-step to live a greener lifestyle to accommodate personal goals and busy lives. We need an ALL-IN-ONE site with which people can start to live a greener lifestyle within 10 minutes. We need a well-structured site that makes it easy for everybody to live a greener life including a network for swarm intelligence to share efficient information to reach the goal fast. That felt good! And so we created RPeople.

RPeopole is a platform and social network where people can find everything they need to live a more sustainable and healthy life more easily – more quickly.

www.rpeople.com is a platform and social network for people who want to live a more healthy and sustainable life. RPeople offer an ALL-IN-ONE solution that helps people to green-up their lives more easily – more quickly.

The key site locations

The R-Check 

Stop wasting your time gathering information on green living to help you figure out how you are going to integrate green living into your life. Just start with the first milestone in the R-Check. Answer only a few questions. Then you will receive your personal task list via email. This task list helps guide you step by step to a greener lifestyle. It also tells you how to go about it. Making green-living changes in your life
has never been easier.

The R-Space 

Have you already begun buying more sustainable products? If so, you have most probably have had to buy several different products before you found the product that also matches your individual style, needs, and quality. What did you do with the products you didn’t like? Are they still in your home or did you throw them away? Such waste of material and time can be reduced, even avoided. In the R-Space, we create regional groups where people living in a certain region can exchange information on products and services of that region. People can save a lot of time and money by asking each other for information before buying a new product.

Categories

In the 8 categories, we offer blogs, forums, a green guide and link selection. Our goal is to find bloggers who write cool blogs and give tips that make green living easier. We focus on easy and fast  problem-solving  methods only. We don’t waste time talking about what is bad, or doesn’t fit into our product wish. This is the exchange platform of the RPeople site.  People here meet on a global level in the forums in order to assist each other with information.

The Shop directory

The green shop directory will also be available as an App. There you are in town, and you suddenly feel like eating an organic burger. All you have to do is take out your smart phone and follow the instructions on the map.

And did you know…

That most suppliers of sustainable products have difficulties finding effective advertising space on internet? On the RPeople site, suppliers can advertise regionally, categorically and globally. It is very important to create ad space for small businesses on the sustainable market. Advertising on RPeople is affordable also for small suppliers. We need to support them in making good business.

Not only do RPeople help people live more healthy and sustainable lifestyles. We help the sustainable market to evolve faster for both small and big suppliers of sustainable products and services.

story:
The Event!

On Saturday, May 31st 2014, NorCal UVSA will be hosting a Charity Gala benefiting OBV at the Vietnamese Community Center in Sacramento, CA. This semi-formal event will include dinner and an array of performances by students and professionals, we will also be giving out VSA awards to our affiliated schools for their dedication and hard work in prompting Vietnamese culture awareness in their own respective communities.

Tickets are $25 Regular, $30 At-Door, and $35 VIP*
*VIP tickets give priority seating at the front tables and first to be served

Doors open at 6:30pm.

What: NORCAL UVSA Charity Gala benefiting OBV
When: Saturday, May 31st 2014 | Doors open at 6:30pm
Where: 6270 Elder Creek Rd | Sacramento, CA 95824


Us and Our Charity & What We Stand For!

US: NORCAL UVSA
www.norcaluvsa.org

The United Vietnamese Student Associations of Northern California (NorCal UVSA) is a non-profit, non-partisan, community-based organization founded in 2002 as a means for youth to organize socially and civically in Northern California. Committed to cultural awareness, educating youth, and community service, UVSA is composed of volunteers—including young professionals, college students, and high school students—to help youth develop a sense of their Vietnamese heritage and identity.

The affiliated members are Vietnamese Student Associations from the following schools:

  • De Anza College
  • San José State University
  • Stanford University
  • University of California, Berkeley
  • University of California, Davis
  • University of California, Merced
  • University of California, Santa Cruz
  • University of the Pacific

THE CHARITY: OBV
www.onebodyvillage.org

The Mission of One Body Village (OBV) is to combat human sex trafficking in developing countries, especially in Vietnam and Cambodia, and to provide at risk children and survivors with shelter, medical and behavioral health care, educational assistance, and vocational training to improve their future.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to be able to donate $1000 to our charity, One Body Village, through the charity gala we are hosting on May 31st at the Vietnamese Community Center in Sacramento, CA.  With that being said we are going to need some funding to put on the event, and that's where you come in! 

Our indiegogo goal is to raise $2000 dollars via donations and ticket purchases. Your contribution will go towards paying for food, rental equipment, and entertainment that will make the night a success! Even if our goal is not reached, all the funds will still be going towards our charity gala, however our event just won't be as awesome and less money will go to OBV (Boooo). 

Some of our perks include handwritten thank you cards from the Executive Board, personalized gifts, publicity and recognition. Each ticket purchased is also considered a "donation" as we are a non-profit organization and the event is benefiting another non-profit organization (Woohoo)!

All donations will be receiving a thank-you email with updates about the event and how much was raised for OBV and a virtual hug from us! :)

Tickets can be purchased and picked up at the door.

The Impact

Your contribution does not only directly fund our event but ultimately will go towards preventing sex trafficking. One Body Village's vision is to abolish child sex trafficking and to establish safe homes for children affected by sex slavery to attain their fullest potentials. NorCal UVSA is also unknown in the Sacramento community, by contributing to our event, you are helping us spread our name and what we do to others inside and out of the Vietnamese community. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar counts but If you cannot contribute, we understand! We would love for you all to share this page with your friends and families :)

THE CHARITY: OBVwww.onebodyvillage.orgThe Mission of One Body Village (OBV) is to combat human sex trafficking in developing countries, especially in Vietnam and Cambodia, and to provide at risk children and survivors with shelter, medical and behavioral health care, educational assistance, and vocational training to improve their future.What We Need & What You GetOur goal is to be able to donate $1000 to our charity, One Body Village, through the charity gala we are hosting on May 31st at the Vietnamese Community Center in Sacramento, CA.  With that being said we are going to need some funding to put on the event, and that's where you come in! Our indiegogo goal is to raise $2000 dollars via donations and ticket purchases. Your contribution will go towards paying for food, rental equipment, and entertainment that will make the night a success! Even if our goal is not reached, all the funds will still be going towards our charity gala, however our event just won't be as awesome and less money will go to OBV (Boooo). Some of our perks include handwritten thank you cards from the Executive Board, personalized gifts, publicity and recognition. Each ticket purchased is also considered a "donation" as we are a non-profit organization and the event is benefiting another non-profit organization (Woohoo)!All donations will be receiving a thank-you email with updates about the event and how much was raised for OBV and a virtual hug from us! :)Tickets can be purchased and picked up at the door.The ImpactYour contribution does not only directly fund our event but ultimately will go towards preventing sex trafficking. One Body Village's vision is to abolish child sex trafficking and to establish safe homes for children affected by sex slavery to attain their fullest potentials. NorCal UVSA is also unknown in the Sacramento community, by contributing to our event, you are helping us spread our name and what we do to others inside and out of the Vietnamese community. Other Ways You Can HelpEvery dollar counts but If you cannot contribute, we understand! We would love for you all to share this page with your friends and families :)

story:
Acquired Brain Injury Rehab was not in Thomas Evers' plans....

But after a near drowning in Cancun, and Thomas being pulled from the pool without vital signs, Thomas and his family have a long road through rehabilitation.  Since the accident on March 12th, Thomas spent 4 days in a Mexican ICU, 5 days in Toronto Sick Children's ICU and 17 days in a general Sick Kids ward. On April 7, Thomas was moved to Holland-Bloorview Kids Rehabilitation Hospital where his initial therapy plan has him scheduled to remain as an in-patient through the end of August.

Thomas is a young and active teen, who plays basketball for his high school, coaches soccer and works at a local Pita place.  He has also been accepted to 4 universities that offer a Business program. (  Brock, Guelph-Humber, Carlton and St Mary's) He now uses all that energy and drive to overcome the hurdles thrown in his path.

Joe and Sandy have not left his side for a minute since that day. They encourage and cheer him on as he works towards a full recovery! This determination shows through the huge strides he has already taken!

Since leaving Sick Kids ICU , Thomas has made some great progress:

  • he had just been extubated and initially had some difficulty breathing, now lungs are clear;
  • he had a feeding tube...but quickly moved to puree, soft foods and now on regular food;
  • he couldn't sit up, now he quickly sits up in bed and rolls to sit at the edge of the bed;
  • he couldn't move his toes or legs....now he stands up and walks...he can bend over and pick up things from the floor;
  • he couldn't talk...his speech therapy has given him some words and techniques;
  • he could hardly lift his arms or clench a fist...he now plays mini basketball catch and Velcro paddle ball with dad and mom!

The hope is that Thomas can make similar progress on the neurological improvements. He has difficulty remembering the current date and where he is. The brain injury currently manifests itself with delusions, short attention span and the need for simple, single step instructions.  Medical staff said this will be a marathon for improvement;at Thomas' body's pace-with times of two steps forward and one back.  The stretch-goal hope that he recovers sufficiently to attend one of the universities at a later date.

Joe and Sandy plan to continue to work with him for the months to come.  To do this,  they have decided that Joe is taking an unpaid  leave from work as IMAX Corp's VP Information Systems with full support from IMAX.

As the Evers family looks ahead, they can anticipate regular and new bills to start building.  There is an estimate of 2-3 years of recovery time expected. This will erode into their savings. 

This fundraising is our attempt to help stem some of that expense. Some may choose to use interac to Aunt Yvonne's email yvonne.steer@hotmail.com

Together, we are Team Thomas!

To support the cause and spread the word, we have Team Thomas stickers and T-shirts. (See the Perks section on how to get yours).

THE LP Bar & Lounge : A Funk & Retro Spot with a Relaxed Atmosphere

Hi, my name is Trish and I am the Founder and Managing Operator for The LP Bar in Freshwater, NSW.  I have been in the hospitality industry my entire life, making hollandaise sauce with my Dad in the kitchen from the age of 5 (he's a Chef and restauranteur with my awesome Mum, my sister and brother-in-law own a restaurant, etc. etc.).  I absolutely love everything about hospitality and people.  It's my favourite industry because you NEVER know what is going to happen next.  There's some thrill in not knowing who can walk into your door and spend the night with you :).  

I love food, drinks, good times and general hardwork.  All of those things make me a fun and serious business woman when it comes to the success of a restaurant I work at.

I have been fortunate to work in 3-Star Michelin restaurants and open "mom-and-pop" style bars & diners.  I have rocked nightclubs, catering companies, hotels, and a whole bunch more.  I have opened 5 restaurants in total, one being my own.  The LP.  

The LP was founded in July of 2013 in Freshwater, NSW.  Due to a rent increase whilst also not being able to renew our lease, we (myself and my wonderful business partner, Regan) have decided to relocate.  It is sad because we have poured so much energy into the success of The LP (and it is JUST starting to turn a profit), but there are huge advantages.  We are relocating to Manly, the hub of the Northern Beaches of Australia and only 3 minutes drive from our current location in Freshwater.  

To a location that is smack in the middle of The Corso and full of people.  To a place that is less rent then what we are currently paying.  To a beautiful spot that needs a little bit of a personal touch of The LP's.  And that's where we need some help.

We are seeking about $100,000 in funding to turn this great location we found into the most-fun, most-relaxing, coolest new small-bar in Manly.  The LP is all about Funk, Sould, Music & Retro in a chilled out atmosphere.  Currently, the place we found, is clean and modern.  Although absolutely beautiful, we need to make it our own!

The LP will host FUN nights like Drag Queen Bingo and Crab Racing!  We want to have Dj's Spinning at Bloody Mary & The Funky Brunch on Sunday Mornings!  We are ready to have a great time whilst taking service and food so seriously, a perfect combination and EXACLTY what Manly is missing!

The funding we are asking for will help us to get The LP to where it needs to be.  We need to purchase plates, furniture, paint, wallpaper, curtains, outdoor dining tables, menus, glassware, etc. etc.  The first LP in Freshwater cost us $60,000 to make our own, and this place we are moving to needs to be more polished and more professional, because the lease is 10 years and we got time on our side.  

My entire career I have been opening succesful restaurants, and this is the second chance I get to do it all over again for my home, the Northern Beaches.  I want Manly to be able to get relaxed in The LP.  It would break my heart and many others if The LP Team couldn't make this project work.

Please try and help if you can, and if you can't financially, that's ok!  Get the word out there for us, because we are ready to go and need some kickin' to help us get there.  And once we are up and running, pop in and say, "heyyyy!"

We are excited to give Indiegogo a try and hopefully get the funds we need to crush this next leg in our lives.  Thanks so much for your time and consideration and see you soon at The LP Manly Location!

Trish

story:
A black cloud of sickness, danger, and even death threatens some families! In the rural areas of Appalachian Ohio some homes have inadequate or no septic tanks and raw sewage is draining directly into streams and seeping into underground water where people have their wells.



     The safety of other homes is destroyed when water leaks blacken the walls, ceilings, and floors with mold and they give way with rot. When sewer lines clog or crumble sewage backs up to flood homes. You can imagine the despair caused when parents don’t have enough funds to protect their families with needed services!



     The World Health Association states that “There cannot be sustained health without sanitation and safe drinking water.”  For the past year Timber Wolff’s Plumbing & Services has used the business’ profit to provide plumbing services to some people who were forced to risk their families’ health by doing without needed services because they lacked enough funds. The need is great and since Timber’s business is so new he doesn’t have the funds to do enough.  Timber Wolff’s Plumbing has the skill, the equipment, and the will to provide the services but he needs help to continue.     



     There are government programs that provide financial assistance for necessary home repair for people with low incomes and we help people to apply. Unfortunately the people who need the services the most are not eligible. Their incomes are too low; they don’t have enough income above their expenses to be eligible for a government loan. These people need help desperately! Plumbing services are not just a convenience; they can mean the difference between health & sickness, safety & danger, and even between life and death! We see their pain and can’t turn away. 

     

     Several years ago Timber went under fire, expecting to be shot, while saving the lives of others. Now he finds himself in even scarier circumstances.  He has risked his business, his home, and everything he owns in his determination to help the people who fall through the cracks of the government programs.  These people need help, their situations are staggering! Given time, Timber knows that the profit from the business will be enough to sustain this project; but now while his business is just starting out he simply can’t do it without help.  With your help we won’t have to turn our backs on the people who need us and together we can accomplish what needs to be done.  Every penny that is donated will be used for the parts and labor needed to provide plumbing services for the people, who for lack of funding must do without.  All donations of all sizes help and for those who cannot donate, your suggestions, advice, or encouragement will be greatly appreciated.  Join us, our partnering nonprofit organization, ‘Wolff’s Extended Paw’, and all the wonderful people who have contributed by telling others about us and following our progress.  If you befriend Timber or Shianne on facebook you’ll be kept informed about what’s going on.  Contact us if you will join Wolff’s Extended Paw, there are no dues or requirements.

 

    Timber grew up in a one room log cabin in the Alaskan bush with his parents, brother, and sister. It would take a whole book to describe the joys and adventures that they shared.  In fact it did, that’s exactly what ‘Alaska Wolff Pack’ is, an illustrated description of their life together. Timber’s sister Shianne was first published at the age of 10 when her correspondence teacher entered a school assignment in a contest.  Since then she has a published novel and her second, ‘Down in the Lake’ will be in print very soon.  She has a compelling way of bringing her readers right into the story to share the suspense and wonder along with the characters.  


     All donations or messages that include an email address will receive a personally written letter and our gratitude.

story:
Short Summary

Brother Prophets~!!!  Harken to the Call~!!!  Help is needed.

  • Merou Grotto M.O.V.P.E.R., part of the Grottoes of North America.
  • As many fraternities have aged, so has that of Merou.  But new membership has taken root and more brothers are bringing with it new ideas, new events, new engagement and a much needed new life.
  • Your contributions would enable the new members to purge the remnant problems of the past and push forward to a new future.  Improvements to the facility WILL bring more than just restored hopes, but it will also enable Merou to directly engage our community as we have only just barely been able to restart and do.
  • We are a 501C8 for Tax Purposes and are in Active Status with both the State of Indiana and US Government.


What We Need & What You Get

Some filling for this project :

  • Our current goal is $45,000.  This would accomplish our primary goal, that would be to purge the damaged tax records of the organization with the county.  Once the taxes are dealt with and out of the way, we would be free and clear to pursue the major improvements to the facility as well as the expansion of our support to our various related philanthropies.
  • Perks!  Merou Grotto is part of the Grottoes of North America (scgrotto.com), and has been a long vibrant part of Tippecanoe County in Indiana for many years.  In addition to having your name recited in a major and very public "thank you" response, additional perks of a more material nature are available as well.
  • Funding that is achieved that goes beyond our tax error restoration, work towards the improvement of the facility as mentioned.  Additional funds will thus go towards the Humanitarian Foundation of the Grottoes of North America. 

Making the Impact Count

  • Merou Grotto has served as a respite for many organizations and peoples to have a local getaway from the stresses of daily life.  Over the decades we have played host to collegiate rowing teams, multi-cultural events, fraternal charities, as well as a vast history in the Birthdays, Quinceanera, Anniversaries and of course Weddings and Vows thereof for countless newlyweds.  We are more than just an event venue ... our property is located immediately adjacent to the Wabash River north of the Downtown Core.  The several acres of forest on the hillside serve as homes for Brown Tail Hawks, Brown and Common Owls, fishing bars for Heron and Cranes.  In the past the Fraternity was able to be a joy-filled organization that did many great works.  It is now headed towards it again.
  • Our Future?  How you'd help?  Merou Grotto sits in the middle of the area directly targeted by the goals and projects of the Wabash River Enhancement Corporation.  As such, Merou has served as host for several Grass-Roots community meetings with the WRE Corporation.  We have already started our year with new projects aimed at directly empowering other local agencies to better serve their needs and thusly our community-at-large.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are tough, there are other ways to help than pure cash :

  • Please Please Please ... share this campaign with everyone you know.  Even if everyone were to only give a few dollars, but it was spread across a LOT OF PEOPLE ... it would work.  It would all work.
  • Remember folks, Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The Real Junk Food Project C.I.C.Ltd

We have been established since Dec 13', and have acquired the leasehold of our 'Pay-As-You-Feel' cafe in Armley, Leeds. 

We intercept 'waste'/surplus food and create healthy meals and allow our customers to donate what they feel for the service they have received. We are also a registered Foodbank.

Since we have been at the cafe serving the public of Armley we have achieved the following:

  • We have intercepted 1269.346kg of food that would have become landfil,
  • and in 249.5 hrs of service, we have managed to serve 421 people,
  • and made 464 meals.

1 billion people worldwide are officially malnourished and/or food insecure, yet as a global nation we discard over 1.3 billion tons of food per annum.

We have been offered the opportunity to purchase our cafe in order for us to become sustainable and feed those that need it the most. The landlord asked for £130,000, so here we are, asking you to help us achieve our goal.

Obtaining the cafe gives The Real Junk Food Project the freedom to expand its network to other towns, cities and countries in order for the entire global nation to have access to healthy meals and food, which they may not be in a position to afford.

Our recent video, kindly made by the Guardian, has highlighted the need for the access to food on a global scale and the importance of what we are doing. Food insecurity affects each and every one of us at some point in our lives, and with the recent deabtes over 'Heating Vs Eating', the need for accss to food is more important than ever before. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in the position to offer money, then you can help us out in so many other ways.

Contact us @ therealjunkfoodproject@outlook.com

We are always on the lookout for volunteers and we have so many side projects for you to get involved in, just drop us an email and we'll get you signed up.

The Real Junk Food Project C.I.C. Ltd
"Let's REALLY feed the world"

story:
6 years ago, after completing college for a degree in business management, I decided to go to culinary school on a whim.  Now my dream is to own my own bakery. I currently work from home doing custom orders. I make cakes for all occasions, as well as cookies, including image cookies and other desserts and edible favors! I'm growing and expanding to the point where I actually NEED a storefront! I've been saving my pennies but any contribution you can offer would be greatly appreciated! I want to be able to run my own business full time in a location where I can continue growing!

I need funding for a location, equipment, marketing, and everything that comes with opening a business. 

My goal is to be able to be open by the end of this year/early next year. Then I can offer goodies to everyone on a regular basis, instead of just custom orders only!

I've offered a wide variety of perks for donations, from brownies to chocolates to cookies!

If I do not reach my full goal by the end, I will simply add the money to my savings until I have enough to open!

Even if you cannot afford to contribute to my campaign, that doesn't mean you can't help me! Simply spread the word to you friends and family and everyone you know!

story:
My name is Kathleen Van Dusen. I am a certified Dr Hauschka Esthetician with a small business in Pasadena, CA. I offer healing, nurturing face and body treatments using the pure, botanical preparations of Dr Hauschka Skin Care. The approach I use is one of encouraging a radiant health, a natural beauty and honoring the body's ability to function with it's own natural rhythm. I love, love, love what I do! I love to encourage the gracefulness of aging, the beauty we each have within and contributing to the healing  of humanity and the earth by working with a company that operates with full integrity. My vision is to build and grow my business so that I can broaden my scope and be in a place of truly giving back.

A few years ago, my husband was in a car accident, totaling the car. The subsequent lawsuit wiped us out of all of our savings. Shortly after that, he was downsized and lost his job in the midst of the economic breakdown. During this time, we lost both of our Roth IRA's. After that, he had a health scare that prevented his working at all! Phew....the good news is that he is back up and running and we see good things ahead. My business is still keeping me busy but I have been unable to function at my full capacity. I am looking for funds to rebuild the retail portion of my practice and get myself to the east coast for a trainng that will then enable me to offer additional treatments to grow by business. More importantly, to me, I will be able to offer my services to those in need, be it illness or financial issues.

Dr Hauschka Skin Care, the company I work with, has been 100% natural for over 40 yrs. They use only the highest quality ingredients available. The products are certified by both NATRUE and BDIH. They use biodynamic farming practices as well as founding and supporting initiatives in developing parts of the world to encourage Biodynamic farming and economic self-sufficiency.

By raising the funds I need, I will be able to encourage and educate more and more people towards a better, healthier, more sustainable way to nurture their health and beauty as well as inspiring them to recognize and foster beauty and well-being in others. Seems the world could use a bit more of that!

I am so appreciative of this opportunity to hopefully raise the bit of money necessary to change the direction of my business and, in turn, help others with my own contributions! If you are unable to donate yourself, feel free to pass this request along to someone who, perhaps can.

Thank you so much.

Namaste'

Kathleen
story_txt:
My name is Kathleen Van Dusen. I am a certified Dr Hauschka Esthetician with a small business in Pasadena, CA. I offer healing, nurturing face and body treatments using the pure, botanical preparations of Dr Hauschka Skin Care. The approach I use is one of encouraging a radiant health, a natural beauty and honoring the body's ability to function with it's own natural rhythm. I love, love, love what I do! story:
Peer Mentoring Program

Like diabetes and asthma, addiction is a chronic disease. Until recently, however, most treatment has been based on a short-term acute care model through which individuals receive 30 to 90 days of treatment and are then returned to the community with the expectation that they automatically have the skills and resources needed to rebuild their life, succeed, and maintain their sobriety. 

Following treatment, these individuals often have no other option but to return to the only lifestyles, neighborhoods, and social networks they know, leaving them highly vulnerable to relapse. When relapse occurs, they are put through the same system again

Mariners Inn’s Peer Mentoring Program will serve individuals and families who are reintegrating into the community following substance abuse treatment and help them to avoid relapse and maintain a healthy, fulfilling, and independent lifestyle.  Recovery support services are ongoing non-clinical services (e.g. social support, mentoring, and linkages to community resources) that help individuals and families who are recovering from substance abuse problems maintain their recovery and improve their quality of life. Recovery support services also provide a bridge back to treatment when needed, ensuring that consumers access treatment promptly rather than waiting until their problem becomes more complex and costly to treat.

 

Services Provided:

  • Access to community resources that address mental health, education, literacy, employment, entitlements, housing and spiritual needs
  • Assist consumers in embracing recovery orientated principles and guidelines
  • Deliver person-centered care
  • Assist consumers with transitioning back into society
  • Assist in finding reliable transportation to appointments and interviews
  • Assist consumer in achieving treatment goals without returning back to treatment and maintain involvement in recovery process

The Impact

Being at Mariners Inn has been the best thing that has happened to me. I have been to two other treatment centers and none of them were as helpful. The staff here truly cares about my recovery and me moving on in life. Through this program I have a better relationship with my son, through the Strengthening Families program. And I have a better relationship with myself. I have set goals now and have the confidence to complete them.
I’m on my way to being a Border Patrol Officer. I am forever thankful and grateful to Mariners Inn.
Jerry E.
 
My life has become better since coming through the doors of Mariner’s Inn. I am a sixtyone year old man with a broken spirit, hopelessness, mentally, and physically bankrupt. I didn’t even love myself and if I can’t love myself how can I love anyone else. Being a drug addict all your life and in the streets, that’s all you know, and your life is down to the animal level. But Mariner’s Inn has shown me a new way to live and a new way of life. They said you can recover. They have given me the tools on a daily basis in my defense against addiction which is a deadly disease. With close to 50 years of addiction, Mariners has given me hope and I’ve become an acceptable, responsible, and productive member of society. Mariner’s goes well beyond the call of duty for everyone who comes through their doors. The staff has much love and passion in doing their job. You can’t puta price tag on it or what they have done for me. They are Angels.
Cedric T.

Other Ways You Can Help

MARINERS INN IS ALWAYS IN NEED OF DONATIONS AND VOLUNTEERS

$0.89 of every $1 you contribute provides direct services to our men!

Your contribution provides food, prescription medication, transportation, and shelter services to our consumers. Thank you for your support!

There's a new way to give to Mariners Inn!

GivingExpress Online allows you to make a donation using your American Express Card or, if you are enrolled in the Membership Rewards program, you can redeem your points for a donation.

 

Pennies can really add up over time with GoodSearch!

Make www.goodsearch.com your homepage and select Mariners Inn as your charity of choice. Every time you search, Mariners Inn will get about 1 cent.

Volunteers can help with a wide range of activities, from serving food to tutoring our clients to doing yard work and sorting the clothing closet. Contact Mrs. Yanish at 313.962.9446 or carinayanish@marinersinn.org if you have questions or want to help out.

Donations - Wish List Items

Below are some items that we can always use. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us.

  • Men's clothing, including clothing and shoes for interviews
  • Food items
  • Bedding (pillows, sheets, blankets, towels)
  • Hygiene kits (toothbrush, toothpaste, deodorant, shaving equipment)
  • Eating utensils (knives, forks, spoons) household
  • Refrigerators
  • Bookcases, lamps, dressers, nightstands, twin beds and other furniture
  • Gardening equipment, snow blowers
  • Volunteers for computer training, computer equipment repair, building and grounds maintenance
  • Paper, envelopes, printing services
  • Financial support

.

story:
Sweet Greetings!

Thank you for clicking our link and making a pledge.

My name is Vanessa Celestine. I was born and raised in Brooklyn, NY, and I currently run iCANDY Baked Goods in a commercial kitchen space that we rent in Brooklyn.

After studying Culinary Arts at The Institute of Culinary Education here in New York, I decided to pursue a career as a Personal Chef, and two years ago iCANDY Baked Goods was born. I was asked to make my nephew's first birthday cake, and since then I've been creating custom cakes and cupcakes for all occasions.

Why does iCANDY Baked Goods need your pledge?

Now, we are expanding to an online bakery and dessert catering company, and we'd also like to sell our signature baked goods at the local Farmers Market.

Some of our new signature items are: 10" & 12" layer cakes with over 20 unique flavors to choose from, pies and tarts, whoopie pies, French macarons, sugar cookies and more. Everything will be made-to-order with fresh local ingredients from the farmer's markets in our area. Orders placed on the new website will be baked and delivered all within 48 hours.

In order to bake up our vision and bring the NYC area more unique treats, we need your help!

Your pledge will help us purchase:

  •  A 20qt mixer
  • More cake pans and baking equipment
  • Eco-friendly packaging materials

Your pledge will also help us get to the farmer's markets and eventually on the shelves of local cafes and specialty grocery stores within the next year.

We are committed to feeding your soul!

If you pledge a donation to our campaign, we have some amazingly delicious treats for you!

You will receive a combination of the following:

  • Our sincere and heartfelt thanks expressed on a specially created iCANDY thank you card
  • A sweet shout out on our Facebook and Twitter pages
  • 1dz cupcakes
  • Jar pies
  • An amazing dessert box filled with all sorts of iCANDY Baked Goods
  • A voucher for a 9" pie or one of our 10" signature cakes (NYC Residents only)
  • Your very own iCANDY Baked Goods tote bag great for shopping or just sporting our brand                                                                    
  • We will create your wedding or special event cake serving 100 guests
          OR
  • We will cater a fun dessert party for you and 20 friends!
 

If you are unable to make a pledge, you can still help us spread the word about our campaigne by sharing our link. Your kindness and generosity are greatly appreciated.

Thank you friends and all of our supporters!

Vanessa Celestine

story:
Our Story

Rhino Productions scours the night seeking unique and odd performers, artists, and musicians. We are dedicated to bringing the unknown talents into the social consciousness. We also strive to put on charity events whenever possible to give back to the community 


The Impact

The lack of support for the Arts in most communities has decreased in recent years due to the economy, and apathy. Our team is an eclectic group of individuals. We have many differences but the same goals, keeping the Arts alive and helping our community. I prefer to keep our relationships with our clients as intimate as possible, with personal correspondence and honest communication. I will never ask our artists to sacrifice their vision or integrity for financial gains. We provide representation and promotion to Unique bands, artists, and burlesque.  We have a film crew and photographers signed, 4 bands, and a few burlesque dancers. We started in November 2011 and have built a solid reputation in the scene, and have raised a large amount of funds for charity as well. We have had fans approach us after a show and thank us for showing them something original and unique, and then they usually say the golden word "ART"! We have finished an Opera that we will be unveiling "The Dawn" in Richardson, Texas at the Eisemann Center on September 29, 2012. That alone put us in the poorhouse, just to book the show. However it is a REAL performing arts center and a dream come true. We may sell out and if so we will profit, if we do not sell out... as of now it will destroy us. Helping us gain the funds necessary to continue on will not only breathe life into Rhino Productions, and all involved, but into the Arts and Entertainment community as well. It has taken us 3 months to do what takes most years to establish, and with no funding or credit. Imagine what we will accomplish with a little funding. Eventually one day, when we are well off,  I want to open a shelter for abused children and teenagers. I have people calling me the worlds poorest philanthropist as it is,

What We Need & What You Get

I have learned (finally) that pride can hold you back, so we are seeking help from all of you wonderful people for the means to obtain the following items
LLC Licensing to make us completely legal
501 3(c) Licensing for our non profit projects                                                         
Our Vehicle, we use for traveling, hauling gear, etc. needs repair                         
Costuming                                                                                                               
Camera Equipment                                                                                                 
Computers and Office equipment                                                                         
Advertising funds for fliers, banners, newspaper ads                                           
Any other things that might come up unexpectedly 
Any thing left over will be used to pay it forward as it were, either donated to charity or used to fund some benefits.
We will be giving anyone that helps us the following thank you gifts!
Donate 5 bucks and we send you an Mp3 download of a track from one of our signed bands, Frausun, The Firefly Nostalgia, or Tattered Grace
Donate 10 and I will send you the link to download Frausun's Opera "The Dawn"
Donate 25 and we will send you an autographed Cd (pre-pressed) of "The Dawn"
Donate 100 and you will receive 1 ticket to the Premiere of "The Dawn" on September 29, 2012 in Richardson, Texas at the Eisemann Center
Donate 200 and You get the autographed CD, a ticket to "The Dawn" and a meet and greet with Frausun after  the show
And finally for 250 and up you get The 200 dollar pack and an extra ticket!
We will personally thank each of you who donates, and will list your name in an upcoming newsletter and on our websites!


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone you know to check our cause out and give our artists a listen. Spread the word. And help us keep our dreams alive! Please, check out our fan pages on Facebook and my personal page. Friend me and I will keep you up to date with RP news.

http://www.facebook.com/texas.hellion   my personal page

http://www.facebook.com/Rhino.Productions.Dallas  Rp's page

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Frausun/207479259288914  Frausun

http://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Firefly-Nostalgia/188605656023 The Firefly Nostalgia

http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001748444109                Tattered Grace 1

http://www.facebook.com/pages/TaTTeRed-GRaCe/157927354242706     Tattered Grace 2

http://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Lil-Bear-Foundation/105796929546519   Our sister  charity (soon to be 501 (3)c designation)

story:
Our Story

In response to the 1968 riots, the L.A. Junior Chamber of Commerce Charity Foundation established the L.A. Watts Summer Games to “build bridges of understanding” among high school youth.  Using sports to foster positive teen development, the Games have involved over 200,000 students from across Southern California. The Games are the nation’s largest high school sports event for teens!


The Games' mission is to promote healthy lifestyles and positive interaction among high school athletes from all ethnic and socio-economic backgrounds. The Games give participants the opportunity to compete on a safe, equal-playing field, while practicing the Games’ credo: to “Play Fair, Respect my Opponent, Win with Integrity, Lose with Dignity and above all, Pursue the Game with Honor.”

The 43rd Annual L.A. Watts Summer Games is set for June 11, 12 and 18 at LA Southwest College and several high schools throughout the Greater L.A. Area.  The Games, modeled after the Summer Olympics, will showcase more than 3,000 athletes competing in basketball, football, soccer, softball, lacrosse and volleyball. More than 200 high schools will be represented in this coming year's competition.  A volunteer force of over 300 parents and supporters will help plan and oversee the Games. To see our kids in action during past LAWSG events please visit: http://www.flickr.com/photos/


To encourage success beyond the playing field, an Opportunities Through Education Day will be hosted at LA Southwest College. Along with college-prep workshops, over 25 universities, community colleges and nonprofits specializing in college-readiness will be on-hand to share information with teens and their parents. 

The Impact

The Games offer high school teens a forum to: (1) showcase their athletic abilities; (2) learn sportsmanship and display positive team spirit; (3) enhance social growth; (4) keep their mind and body healthy; and (5) stay in school and consider post-secondary education.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to cover the costs of sports equipment, education day activities, T-shirts, medals and refreshments provided to the more than 3,000 high school competitors, officials and volunteers. The LA Junior Chamber of Commerce Charity Foundation is an established 501(c)(3), nonprofit organization. Your contribution is tax deductible as a charitable donation. Please visit: http://www.lawsg.org/.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this link with your network of friends, family and co-workers. We will also need volunteers to support the Games competitions and Education Day. Our youth need our help; and together we can make a significant difference in their lives.

The Games' mission is to promote healthy
lifestyles and positive interaction among high school athletes from all ethnic
and socio-economic backgrounds. The Games give participants the opportunity to
compete on a safe, equal-playing field, while practicing the Games’ credo: to “Play
Fair, Respect my Opponent, Win with Integrity, Lose with Dignity and above all,
Pursue the Game with Honor.”
 
The 43rd Annual L.A. Watts
Summer Games is set for June 11, 12 and 18 at LA Southwest College and several high schools throughout the
Greater L.A. Area.  The Games, modeled after the Summer Olympics, will
showcase more than 3,000 athletes competing in basketball, football, soccer,
softball, lacrosse and volleyball. More than 200 high schools will be
represented in this coming year's competition.  A volunteer force of over 300
parents and supporters will help plan and oversee the Games. To see our kids in action during past LAWSG events please visit: http://www.flickr.com/photos/

To encourage success beyond the playing field, an Opportunities Through Education Day will be hosted at LA Southwest College. Along with
college-prep workshops, over 25 universities, community colleges and nonprofits
specializing in college-readiness will be on-hand to share information with
teens and their parents.  
The Impact
The Games offer high school teens a forum to: (1)
showcase their athletic abilities; (2) learn sportsmanship and display positive team spirit; (3)
enhance social growth; (4) keep their mind and body healthy; and (5) stay in
school and consider post-secondary education.
 
What We Need & What You Get
We need funds to cover the costs of sports
equipment, education day activities, T-shirts, medals and refreshments provided to the
more than 3,000 high school competitors, officials and volunteers. The LA Junior Chamber
of Commerce Charity Foundation is an established 501(c)(3), nonprofit
organization. Your contribution is tax deductible as a charitable donation.
Please visit: http://www.lawsg.org/.

Other Ways You Can Help
Share this link with your network of friends,
family and co-workers. We will also need volunteers to support the Games
competitions and Education Day. Our youth need our help; and together we can make a significant difference in their lives.

story:
ABOUT US - The Igloo Construction Company "Unique Locations"

 

The austrian company Unique Locations is a start-up company and still in its infancy. The idea for the company was founded by Günther Brunner's passion for winter, snow, and art. Intrigued by the opportunity to combine these three things, he learned how to build igloos, became a professional igloo builder, and founded the company together with Jennifer Nessler at his side.

Therefore, the companies area of expertise is the commercial construction of igloos. We focus our work on conceptual design, planning, construction, artistic design and maintenance of snow structures as well as giving accompanying advice on the use of igloos for hotel or catering purposes.

 

Igloo constrution with intelligence & passion

 

Günther Brunner is the heart and head of the company. As the only government approved master igloo builder in Austria, Brunner has created snow igloos of incomparable quality and size over the last twelve years. His passion for building igloos has already sent him on adventurous journeys, e.g. to one of the most Northern spots in Europe, to Swedish Lapland, close to the Arctic Circle. He made his mark in history with the construction of the world’s biggest igloo for the German TV channel “PRO7” and its entry into the “Guinness Book of World Records”.

 

The Fine Art of Building Igloos

 

You must know your business: We take every contingency into consideration when building an igloo – from the preparations to taking the igloo down again, you benefit from our profound and highly specialized knowledge.Thanks to the so called „balloon“–technique which partly was developed by Brunner, snow palaces are built more effectively, faster and more stable than with the traditional “cube”-technique. Unique Locations sees a rough diamond in every single igloo. With passion for detail and the necessary experience each igloo gets its individual finishing touches and transforms into one brilliant and unique world of its own.

 

The Diversity of Igloos

 

In the past, Inuits mostly used igloos to stay safe, warm and as a space for living. Today, there is no limit on how to use the interior of an igloo:

  • As event location: art shows, parties, receptions, incentives, sport events, museum, casino, etc.
  • As exclusive hotel: igloo hotel, separate igloo suites, etc.
  • As catering business: igloo bar, igloo restaurant, etc.

 

What we need - HOW YOU CAN HELP!

 

Last season our company ran a project called “The Fridge” with total costs of more than 120.000 euros.  Unfortunately, the winter season was very bad and we also had bad luck with some of our so called “partners”, so we lost all the money we invested and still have a big amount of money to pay to our providers. In fact we would have to close down to company if we don’t find a solution.

On the other side “The Fridge” was an important project and another milestone in the history of igloo construction as it was the first igloo 600 m over sea level.

 

As more and more people and countries get to know our products we already have requests for more projects this season, which makes us able to pay part of our depts.

But still 40.000 Euros are missing to save the company and the dream of constructing more individual igloo works of art. No bank institute is willing to lend us money, as we are a small company and young owners without a big financial background we don’t have the safety for the bank that they need because of the economic situation worldwide - so we need your help to save our existance…

 

 

What you get!

 

We provide the following:

  • Igloo building workshop
  • A free overnight stay in an igloo, with your friends

story:
Help Us Make Adam Z1 the World's Smartest Robot
-- and Launch a Revolution in AI

We are a team of seasoned AI and robotics experts, and we're asking for your kind participation in our quest to give our robot Adam Z1 the mental ability of a three year old child.

Who needs a robot with the brain of a three year old child, you ask?  Aren’t there enough bratty 3 year olds in the world?

The point is -- a three year old has one critical thing that all current AI programs lack: COMMON SENSE.

By using the OpenCog Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) architecture to create a childlike mind for our Hanson Robokind robot Adam Z1, we will be doing more than just making Adam the world's smartest robot.  We will be creating the first AI system with real common sense understanding.

Currently the intelligence of robots is limited by their reliance on “narrow AI systems” – AI programs that are good at doing one particular task but lack the ability for generalized intelligence, because theyare  unable to comprehend and interpret the world around them.   

Once the common sense bottleneck is passed, all sorts of amazing practical AI applications will become possible – the world will be transformed.  

Creating a robot toddler is an amazing project unto itself, but even more amazing in terms of what it will lead to – a core AGI engine that understands the everyday human world, and can power an unlimited variety of intelligent robots and computer systems.

Today, in 2013, we have powerful computers, deep knowledge of cognitive and neural science, and fantastic robots like Adam Z1.  We have the knowledge it takes to make a critical breakthrough in AGI robotics.  We are at the point where we can make the long-time dreams of the AI field come to life.

All we need is just a little bit of research funding, to help us make it happen.

And that’s where you come in.

If you want to be part of research that will change the world in countless astounding ways, this is your chance!

Geni Lab

Here at Geni Lab we’ve assembled some of the world’s top experts to break through the barrier and give Adam what we refer to as “robotic common sense”, meaning the ability to adapt, interpret, and apply knowledge to make more intelligent decisions.   By integrating the OpenCog AGI architecture with the Adam Z1 robot and teaching the robot in our lab, we believe that we can make Adam roughly as intelligent as a three year old toddler!

Furthermore, all the research we do on Adam Z1 will be open source and available to the public. This means that we – and others – will be able to apply this new technology to address many of the world’s vital problems.  

Check out our Geni Lab website for more information, including a 7 minute video overview surveying the work of Geni Lab’s key researchers.

The Intelligence of Robot Adam Z1

If we are able to fund this project, Adam Z1 will far surpass the intelligence of current robots and will acquire what we equate to “toddler level intelligence”.  This means that Adam will be able to accomplish the following tasks and many more:

  • Play with Toys: Adam will build using blocks and play with other children’s toys
  • Draw Pictures: Adam will interact with an IPad and use it to draw pictures that represent anything from his thoughts to how he interprets his environment
  • Communicate with Humans: Using his OpenCog powered brain, Adam will speak with us and tell us what he is thinking, what he wants, and respond to your questions. Technically, this is referred to as “experientially grounded language understanding and generation.”
  • Respond to Human Emotion: With David Hanson’s help, Adam will display human emotions at a level that far surpasses current robots. Taking it a step further, Adam will even be able interpret your emotions and respond accordingly. If Adam thinks you’re sad for example, he can cheer you up with a happy remark or funny joke!
  • Schedule and Make Plans: Adam will make reasonable and rational decisions and plan a schedule accordingly. If you want to have a discussion with him about a specific topic later that day, Adam can remind you!

The Impact of Robotic Intelligence 

Science fiction tends to focus on the possible downsides of advanced AI, because crises and battles make exciting stories.   In reality, though, AI like the kind we’re building for Adam Z1 has the potential to enhance the lives of billions of people. Here are just some of the vital problems and impacts that intelligent AI can have on our society:

  • Short term (3-5 years): An AI with common sense understanding and basic general purpose thinking ability, once created, can be expected to rapidly pervade cutting-edge areas in the software and hardware industry, including scientific data analysis, adaptive control of industrial and consumer robots, video game AI, internet search, automated question answering
  • Mid Term (5-20 years): Once the common sense bottleneck has been passed, AGI can be expected to transform essentially every industry on the planet, step by step.   Two areas that interest us especially are service robots (robots to clean the house, robot assistants to follow you everywhere and help you with the tedia of everyday life, robot tutors to help the kids, etc.), and AGI scientists (imagine a biology lab where experimental design, data analysis and lab equipment operation is all done by an integrated AGI system, networked with thousands of similar systems around the world – how much progress would be made at curing disease and prolonging life that way?)
  • Long Term (20+ years): We are fans and friends of Ray Kurzweil and Vernor Vinge.   A toddler-like mind for Adam Z1 will be a big step beyond the current state of robotics – but the REALLY big step will be when the global network of robots, AGI programs and human beings moves on to a radically superhuman sort of general intelligence.   This may sound fanciful, but no more so than the Internet would have sounded in 1925.  But to get to the awesome Singularity scenarios that Kurzweil and Vinge talk about, we need to take first steps first.  The next step on the path involves the achievement of basic, everyday robotic common sense … such as we plan to inculcate in Adam Z1 over the next couple years.  

The World Renowned Team

Hailing from across the world, the Geni Lab leadership team consists of the following experts capable of making this dream a reality:

Ben Goertzel - Building the Brain. World renowned leader in Artificial General Intelligence. Leader of the OpenCog Artificial Intelligence Project and the AGI conference series, author of numerous books and research papers on AGI, founder of multiple commercial AI projects.

David Hanson – Creator of the Adam Z1 robot.  David’s company Hanson Robokind builds the Zeno line of humanoid robots, of which Adam Z1 is an early example. 

Mark Tilden – Expert on Robot movement. The inventor of BEAM robotics and creator of the WowWee RoboSapien Humanoid Robots.   He is the man to make Adam move with naturalness and broad capability.

Gino Yu – Consciousness and Human-Machine Interaction Expert.  Gino is the Principal Investigator of the current OpenCog project at Hong Kong Poly U, where he serves as a professor.   An expert in human-computer interaction, he will mastermind the social and emotional aspects of Adam Z1’s software.

Together,this "Dream Team"'s vast experience and deep seeded motivation to enhance humanity through robotics and artificial intelligence makes us the perfect team to expand the boundaries of intelligent AI.

The Timeline

With your funds, we plan to hire some of the world’s top developers and build Adam’s new mind according to the following rough timetable:

  • 4 months- Basic Functionality: Adam will be playing with blocks and other toys and following  simple English instructions
  • 8 months- Interpretive Functionality: He’ll be using English to describe what I'm doing and responding to the emotions I see on peoples' faces with my own emotions
  • 12 months- Complex Functionality: He’ll be capable of understanding and speaking more complex sentences and carrying out longer sequences of actions. I’ll be able to express myself and my thoughts through art.
  • 18 months: Full Functionality: He’ll be playing more creatively and flexibly, and initiating all sorts of conversations and actions at an intelligence level comparable to that of a three year old toddler.

Changing the World

Adam Z1, awesome as he is going to be once we’ve built his new mind, is only a small representation of the immense potential that AGI possess.   This technology has the potential to impact everyone’s life dramatically and positively, and now is your chance to get involved! Through this project you have the opportunity to help push humanity forward and forever cement your legacy in the future of artificial intelligence!

story:
Summary

 

Hi, I'm Abraham Carattini, founder, inventor, visionary, patent holder, athelete and member of consortium comprised of inventors, NASA aerospace engineers, contract and patent attorneys, concept marketers and product development teams.  Partnered with an engineering specialist and owner of LED lighting company.

 

Prolight Boards

In September 2008, Abraham Carattini, founder of PROLIGHT BOARDS, INC., was returning home late one night. While only a few blocks from his home, which is near a skating park, he pulled up to a red light to make a right turn. Thinking all was clear, he began the turn and almost hit a skater who seemed to appear out of nowhere. Abraham was shaken by the thought that the skater could have been seriously injured. He wondered how many other skaters had not been quite as fortunate. From this experience he came up with the idea of an LED lighted skateboard. Immediately, he began working on a prototype that would provide this safety feature without compromising the integrity of the board. After research revealed the breadth and scope of the skateboarding industry, Abraham realized that he had a solid, if not revolutionary, idea.

PROLIGHT BOARDS, INC. is an innovative sport-board lighting company that holds patented LED lighting technology for skateboards.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

These are the various phases we're looking to provide 100,000+ funding towards...

 

Phase 4 (Need Funding)

  • FINISHED MANUFACTURED PRODUCTS:                                      

Inventory of a full line of skate boards; seven different design shapes of the push button and remote control modes.

Phase 5 (Need Funding)

  • DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNOLOGY FOR ACCESSORY LINE:

Ongoing development, production and packaging of software, product line, safety gear and a “safety oriented” clothing line. Solidify relationships with our sales channels and accounts.

Phase 6 (Need Funding)

  • PRODUCT EXPANSION: 

Expansion in manufacturing for wood boards, PLB brand trucks, and PLB brand wheels.

Our Perks like most surround our product. We offer the supporters to be the first to rock a cool personal logo T-Shirt of the pattoned Blue Angler Fish, really cool Personalized Prolight Board Plague with engraved gifter's name or Our very own Signature Long Boards which can been seen on our website www.prolightboards.com

If we fail to reach our goal, we'll use the funding to help market the product and manufacture some boards that could drawl heavy interest of investors and venture capitalist backing on continuance of covering the 3 Phases to bring this dream to a reality.

 

A FUN PROLIGHT BOARDS VIDEO (Check it out!!!)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvuPRwBDPDk

 

The Impact

LED lighting and board design not only allows a skater distinctive individualization and self-expression, but introduces innovative concepts and new trends for a growing market. The technology also makes skaters more visible at night which decreases the likelihood of being hit by vehicles.

Once launched in the United States, ProLight plans to expand internationally, initially targeting Australia where night skateboarding has been banned due to accidents and injuries resulting from skaters not being visible at night. The law provides the perfect opportunity to highlight ProLight’s unique attributes that blend safety and creative inspiration to revolutionize the skateboarding industry.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

A lot of lives have been lost surrounding drivers and skateboarder related accidents at night. You, yourself might know someone who has been gravely injured or lost they're life because a similar accident.

In 2011, there were 42 reported cases of skateboarders killed in California, Texas, and Virginia. The numbers continue to grow in 2012, and 2013 due to poor visibility. City ordinances are being placed, to prohibit skateboarders from riding after sunset. On April 15, 2013 a 12 year-old-girl was killed in Florida crossing a road at night and May 4, 2013 An 8-year-old Jefferson Hills boy died after being hit by a car Friday night. These numbers continue to soar. So if u can't help monetary, please get the word out via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, and of coarse the old fashion way "Word of Mouth" about this campaign because this won't just help us, it may help one of your love ones one day. Don't forget, there's Indiegogo share tools to help make things easier in your quest to make Prolight Boards a reality.

 

ANDREW'S STORY

http://abclocal.go.com/kabc/story?section=news/local/orange_county&id=6773853

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TeJRG_ceW5I&feature=youtu.be (Extended Interview)

 

JOIN THE PROLIGHTS BOARD MOVEMENT!!!

Friend us at www.facebook.com/teamprolight.boards and get your board
on Indiegogo to create your own team within your City, State, or
Country. Team Prolight Boards can only grow with your help.
An please share your experience and photo’s, once you receive your
board on our facebook page. We’re excited to have you apart.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvuPRwBDPDk
 
The Impact
LED lighting and board design not only allows a skater distinctive individualization and self-expression, but introduces innovative concepts and new trends for a growing market. The technology also makes skaters more visible at night which decreases the likelihood of being hit by vehicles.
Once launched in the United States, ProLight plans to expand internationally, initially targeting Australia where night skateboarding has been banned due to accidents and injuries resulting from skaters not being visible at night. The law provides the perfect opportunity to highlight ProLight’s unique attributes that blend safety and creative inspiration to revolutionize the skateboarding industry.

 

Other Ways You Can Help
A lot of lives have been lost surrounding drivers and skateboarder related accidents at night. You, yourself might know someone who has been gravely injured or lost they're life because a similar accident.
In 2011, there were 42 reported cases of skateboarders killed in California, Texas, and Virginia. The numbers continue to grow in 2012, and 2013 due to poor visibility. City ordinances are being placed, to prohibit skateboarders from riding after sunset. On April 15, 2013 a 12 year-old-girl was killed in Florida crossing a road at night and May 4, 2013 An 8-year-old Jefferson Hills boy died after being hit by a car Friday night. These numbers continue to soar. So if u can't help monetary, please get the word out via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, and of coarse the old fashion way "Word of Mouth" about this campaign because this won't just help us, it may help one of your love ones one day. Don't forget, there's Indiegogo share tools to help make things easier in your quest to make Prolight Boards a reality.
 
ANDREW'S STORY
http://abclocal.go.com/kabc/story?section=news/local/orange_county&id=6773853
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TeJRG_ceW5I&feature=youtu.be (Extended Interview)
 
JOIN THE PROLIGHTS BOARD MOVEMENT!!!
Friend us at www.facebook.com/teamprolight.boards and get your boardon Indiegogo to create your own team within your City, State, orCountry. Team Prolight Boards can only grow with your help.An please share your experience and photo’s, once you receive yourboard on our facebook page. We’re excited to have you apart.

story:
Hi my name is Zachary Palmer. I am from Owings Mills, Maryland and am currently preparing for my Bar Mitzvah.  I really like working with children and helping others.  This past summer, I worked as a TNT (Top Notch Teen Program) at the Jewish Community Center.  I helped out in the preschool and then in the afternoon had a chance to socialize and play sports with the other TNTs. Those that know me, know that I love sports and can usually be found outside playing baseball or basketball. 

My Mom made her first trip to Israel with the Jewish Women’s Renaissance Program this year.  When she returned she told me about a place called Shalva that she visited.  I learned about all the amazing children there and knew that I wanted to help them.  Shalva , in Hebrew, means “peace of mind”. They have helped over 500 babies, children, adolescence, and young adults with special needs.  All at no cost the family.  Shalva staff focuses on social interaction, so that the children can integrate into the community.  What better way to be social then by playing sports!  You can learn more about Shalva at : www.shalva.org .

I hope to help the children of Shalva by combining the two things I like to do, helping children and sports. This special website has been set up to send funds to Israel where new sports equipment can be purchased by Shalva for the children.  I really would appreciate your assistance with this project, and hope one day to visit Israel so I can meet the children of Shalva and see the benefits of the mitzvah.
