story:
If only the actual bakery could be put together so quickly!

p.s. That's not me in the video. You can tell because her clothes are not covered in powdered sugar.

About this wacky adventure upon which you have stumbled:

After seven and a half years as a public school teacher working with adolescents with behavior "issues", I am trading my behavior lessons for recipe cards. I have been designing and creating custom cakes as a hobby for four years; it's time to go pro. With your help, I will open a custom, small batch bakery in the Auburn/ Opelika area this summer.

So...?

Opening a bakery takes money, y'all! I am looking for $2000 to cover some of the costs of the build-out. I've been hitting restaurant auctions for the past year or two to get as much equipment as I can. I still need the triple sink, the big mixer. some shelving and other less interesting bakery gear. Oh, and someone to install it all when I find the perfect location! 

If we surpass this goal, you and me, the additional funds will go to paying for more of the build out (I'm expecting the total to be up to $10,000, depending on the location), the first few months of rent, and other wacky things like insurance, license fees, and inventory. You're giving me a running start!

And...?

Now, what can I offer you in exchange for your support? Obviously, you get bragging rights: you'll have helped create one of the most creative cake studios in the South! You also get my undying gratitude in the form of your name proudly displayed on the wall of the bakery for at least a year (no matter the size of your contribution). Then, there are the tasty treats and experiences I have to offer. You should really check those out. They're over there in the gray boxes ->

AND, any donation you make at the $100 level or higher will score you an invitation to our Grand Opening Reception, a super-chic soiree when the shop is ready to open. 

*Make sure you include your e-mail address so that we can contact you and get you your perks*

Go on...

Since I started on this whole cake adventure, I have met some interesting characters. I have had the privilege of caking for some of the kindest people there are. I genuinely believe that people matter. They deserve to be appreciated and celebrated. And so, when an important occasion like a birthday, wedding, or anniversary rolls around, I think people deserve to celebrate with a cake that was made just for them:  designed, baked, and decorated with them in mind.

Cakeapotamus will offer custom cakes, cupcakes, cookies, and other treats, including those little pink things everyone seems to love.. We will also offer tea parties for kids and their dolls or bears and evening cake decorating classes for adults. I'm even working on getting the permits required so you can bring your own wine and REALLY enjoy decorating your cake. It's going to be a great place, y'all. I can't wait for you to see it!

Anything else?

I'll take all the help I can get making this adventure happen. Help me spread the word, you guys! Tell your friends about this fundraising project (especially your rich friends who like cake). Tell everybody you know about the awesome new bakery that's opening this summer. But most importantly, please come visit the shop when it opens. I'll see you there!

 

 

Questions? Please feel free to e-mail: cakeapotamus@gmail.com

story:
For anyone who truly knows me (Russ Carlton) and my daughter, you also know that for the last 10 years we have been forced to engage in one lawsuit after another. This whole process has been financially and emotionally devastating for my 11 year old daughter and I. Truly, it has affected my entire family. The legal bills have been astronomical. The constant stream of lies and accusations that are posted on the internet about us are hurtful. It is hard having all your life and all your daughter's life strung out for everyone to see. Especially when it is twisted and manipulated as it has been. The legal process surrounding the custody of my daughter has spanned almost a decade now. I am tired. But I will always endeavor to act in the best interests of my daughter. I always have.

 

Seeking to create a better life for my daughter and I, I  accepted the invitation of friends to relocate to Brazil, where I am now an English teacher, consultant and translator. This change in life style has been a great shift for a better present and future for the two of us.

 

 

 

In May 2013, we won the latest legal battle, in which the American courts found me not in contempt of court for having chosen to move to Brazil, given my constitutional rights as a sole parent to change residency as I wish or need. The request of grandparent’s visitation has found to be secondary over my parental rights. I thank all the friends and family who joined me in this process. Without them this would not had been possible.

 

 

 

Yet, we have another battle ahead of us: the need to request for modification for the grandmother’s visitation rights. She is requesting that Winnie be present in our former home address in Maryland for her visitation on a monthly basis. For obvious reasons, this is impossible and we need to request the courts to transfer jurisdiction of the case to where we now reside. That means, I need to come up with another minimum of $5,000 dollars to pay for legal attorney fees. We have a high chance to succeed! Yet, I don’t have any more means to proceed with the financial burdens of another legal challenge.

 

 

 

My friends have encouraged me to join this website and ask for donations towards my cause. As a father I feel it is my responsibility to protect my daughter on my own. Yet, I know I can no longer afford it, and can’t take the risk of not defending my daughter's rights in court. So, I decided to ask for your help. I thank you in advance and invite you to read the petition I created to inform people about this case. My daughter is my life. I am grateful beyond words for the loving support we have received. Without it, we could not have endured. If you feel like you can donate, any amounts are welcoming.

 

 

 

Truly Yours,

 

 

 

Russ

story:
LET'S KEEP GOING

On behalf of everyone at Columbia Heights Community Marketplace, we want to thank all of the donors and market customers who helped us reach our goal for the Farmers Market Thanksgiving less than two weeks into our campaign! Because of your overwhelming – and humbling – generosity, we have already met our $2,500 goal. Your support is the only thing that allows us to continue working to build an inclusive, vibrant marketplace for the community, so thank you once again.

Our original goal was to provide $50 dollars to 50 low-income neighborhood families, for them to spend at the market in the weeks leading up to Thanksgiving. As always, the demand exceeded our expected supply of nutritional assistance funds. Many more than 50 families – all of whom rely on nutritional assistance programs to help them shop at the market – signed up for the program. With your continued support, we have the chance to make an even bigger impact this Thanksgiving.

Help us double our goal – and help twice as many neighborhood families – by raising $5,000 before the campaign closes on November 15.  And if you’ve already donated, please reach out to friends and family and let them know how much you enjoy the farmers market, and how important it is to ensure everyone in the community has a place to shop this Thanksgiving.


FARMERS MARKET THANKSGIVING

Food changes lives. Walk down any street and see how bad food ruins people's lives. Good food makes people's lives better. But good food can be expensive and challenging to cook. 

The most important food day is Thanksgiving. Think about how much the average family spends on a Thanksgiving spread and how much joy it generates. Thanksgiving is all about sharing. You stuff the face of everyone around you and then have plenty of leftovers to share for days afterwards.

This year we gave out close to $10,000 in matching funds to families in need shopping at the market on nutritional assitance programs. We want to raise an additional $2,500 to give 50 of those families money to spend for their Thanksgiving dinner. They can buy anything they want from any vendor at the Columbia Heights Community Marketplace Farmers Market. This is a win-win. Families in need get fresh, wholesome food right at Thanksgiving, and the money goes to support local farmers and food producers.

We want folks to think of food as a cause and think of the Columbia Heights Community Marketplace as a solution to food access. Most people think of us as just a farmers market but we're more than that. We help feed families and support local farmers and food businesses.

By raising this modest amount of money, we want to show how food can make a difference in people's lives and establish the Marketplace as an organization with a mission of changing lives through fresh, healthy local food.

Give the gift of good food today and help make a difference.

story:
THE COMPANY:

A For-Profit, Socially Responsible, Social Network Advertising and Marketing Company. 

ieCost is a for-profit, socially responsible, social network advertising and marketing company that maximizes consumer savings by leveraging consumers power to choose the products they want and by returning the company’s profits to consumers in the form of savings on their purchases.

ieCost is designed for People and Families who want to pay less on their EVERYDAY purchases.

Using purchasing power to reestablish fair prices, the Mission of ieCost is to facilitate economic betterment and wellness for all people.

At ieCost, we earn revenue by mass-market Brand advertising and marketing strategies; developing relationships among the ieCost consumers and exclusive Businesses so that both benefit economically.

ieCost then transfers its profits into financial benefit–rewards for ieCost consumers.


THE WHY 

Directed by Social Responsibility, ieCost believes middle and lower class working people need an economic break. As consumers they need to be able to purchase everyday necessities at reasonable prices.

Middle and lower class working consumers deserve a much-needed economic break.  Hard-working People and Families must be able to afford more – to get much more for their money.

Yet there is an increasingly disproportionate distribution of wealth between today’s stockholders and today’s working consumers.

At ieCost we recognize the consumer has a direct impact on any company's success; the consumer is investing his/her money when purchasing a product.

Therefore, we believe that the consumer should reap a financial reward in accordance with the success of the companies they chose to support, just like a stockholder.

We at ieCost are committed to that principle with our hearts, minds, spirits, and with our profits.


THE HOW

It is simple: Only with your help! Only You, consumers, can help create a company for consumers. Voice your choice by . . .

Giving at least one dollar . . .

Telling at least one person about ieCost . . .

Join millions of consumers finally able to have the opportunity to benefit from their own purchases.

Let’s Create: a philanthropic company.


HOW ieCost WORKS:

Online Registration at ieCost.com “There are No Fees”

Become an ieCost Consumer

Buy at Cost. Buy online or retail stores. Every day, all year long, buy only top quality products & services you normally buy.

Get incredible promotional offers, up to 100% free from ieCost.

You get it totally free: Entertainment & food for the whole family. ieCost will provide its promotional community events & concerts.




                     SAVE on everything you normally buy everyday, all year with the “You-Save Card.” 
                      • Savings are in addition to any store discounts, coupons, or promotions.

                      Save all year long every time you pump gas. “Cost-Less Gas Card”

                      Save 5% to 10%. Families will save thousands of dollars “Cost-Less Grocery Card”
                      • Savings are in addition to any store discounts, coupons, or promotions.
                      • Even if you use Food Stamps you can still save.

                      Up to 80% savings. Buying at cost. Pharmacy and over-the-counter drugs. 
                      Use the “Cost-Less Pharmacy Card.”

                      Your-Doctor… local doctors working together.
                      Use the “Doctors Cost-Less Card.” 

                      EVENTS & CONCERTS FOR YOUR COMMUNITY: Totally free
                      entertainment & food for the whole family--festivals, carnivals, and
                      health fairs, top chart artists, performers, and sport professionals.

___________________________________________________________________________________

IN ADDITION PLEASE NOTE: 
Products & services will be available to the ieCost Consumers. 
However, these existing incredible values are offered to 
fund contributors only, at this time. 

PLEASE NOTE BELOW: 
Additional examples of the many top products & services and 
the everyday savings that ieCost will work to make available. 

___________________________________________________________________________________



FIRST:
Make a Contribution of any size. Even if it is only a $1, it will help fund ieCost and achieve our goals.

SECOND:
Take advantage, of the ieCost REFERRAL CONTEST:

You as an individual have the opportunity to win big prizes. This is a fantastic way for non-profit organizations and for-profit companies to receive great prizes. (See details below.)

Tell everyone you know about ieCost. Use Indiegogo’s Share Tools. Send a message to your whole list of contacts: Emails, Twitter, Text, Facebook, LinkedIn, Blogs and all other networks.

Remember: Call or email your favorite non-profit organizations, tell your neighbors, and tell strangers at the mall. Tell every one you see. 

Challenge everyone to make a Contribution. Challenge each one to tell everyone about ieCost.

Re-send the message. Everyone needs reminders.



FIRST $50,000

STAGE 1:   
ESTABLISH TO-DO BUSINESS REQUIREMENTS & SALES STRATEGIES  (3 to 4 months)
Estimated benefits to ieCost Consumers encompassed in conditional contracts of “Stage 1” with the business clients is around 3 to 7 million dollars.

  1. GOALS ALREADY ACHIEVED (Donated effort: $105,000):
    a. Developed business & marketing model and implementation strategies,
        initial contacts, & business agreements with parties.
    b. Researched & defined & developed requirements for production, marketing, and execution.
    c. Pre-arrangements with the supporting vendors, businesses, and professionals.
  2. GOALS TO ACHIEVE (Time effort is donated: $70,000): 
    a. Implement presentation and full-scale sales strategies. 
    b. Obtain conditional contracts from 20 national business clients (need only 5). Also, per 
        region: 20 large businesses and 20 start-ups or small businesses (need only 10 of each). 
    c. Finalize contracts of already-obtained agreements with supporting vendors, businesses, 
        and professionals. 
    d. With conditional contracts in effect, define & develop requirements of implementation for 
        marketing of the business clients’ products and services.
  3. FUNDS TO PAY LEGAL FEES: 
    a. Implement all legal requirements to conduct business, corporate, and contractual 
  4. FUNDS TO PAY PROFESSIONAL FEES: 
    a. Implement all accounting and company structure 
  5. FUNDS TO PAY PERSONAL & GENERAL COST:
    a. Staff three office support personnel 
    b. Freelance two to four graphic artists & production assistants
    c. Sales meeting/meals & travel for five Sales coordinators
        (Note: coordinators will donate time effort of $10,000 each)


ADDITIONAL $100,000

STAGE 2:   
100% BUSINESS READY IMPLEMENTATION: TAKE-TO-MARKET (4 to 6 months)

  1. GOALS TO ACHIEVE:
    a. Finalize one-year full commitment contracts from business clients and vendors
    b. Finalize three to five year full commitment contracts from national business clients
        and vendors 
  2. GOALS TO ACHIEVE:
    a. ieCost will be completely self-sustainable

  3. FUNDS TO PAY PERSONAL & GENERAL COST: 
    a. Take-to-market: Full production and implementation 
    b. Staff support personnel as required by growth 
    c. Freelance graphic artists & production individuals as required by growth 
    d. Web & IT Support


ANY ADDITIONAL FUNDS ABOVE $150,000

STAGE 3:   
ieCost BUSINESS EXPANSION (4 to 7 years)
Any additional funding will help in a quicker expansion across America. Estimated need: $25,000 per major market.

Estimates in total economic saving benefit to ieCost Consumers across America felicitated directly or indirectly by ieCost are incredible.

  1. GOALS TO ACHIEVE:
    a. Implement ieCost’s business model fully onto top 100 markets and all across America.



THANK YOU! It is with great appreciation that ieCost receives your funding contributions. The reward ieCost gives you is VIP Value:

VIP Specific-Value
VIP Unit-Value
VIP Honor-Value
VIP Honor-Value Member 
VIP Business-Value
VIP Exclusive Business Client

Our motto is “Give YOU what YOU want.” We recognize everyone has different likes and dislikes. We ultimately let you choose the products & services you want. Redeem your VIP Values…. over time there will be hundreds of products & services to choose from.


VIP VALUES AND HOW TO REDEEM

It is simple. The Perks*: top products & services will be donated to ieCost to be given to fund contributors in exchange for the VIP Values.

ieCost will email the fund contributor a confirmation and a VIP Value Certificate, within 15 days after full funding confirmation by Indiegogo. The Certificate--the VIP Values will redeem or be exchanged for products & services. As additional products & services become available, VIP Value selections can be made and final selections are confirmed.

Each item in the Perks section indicates how many and what type VIP-Values are to be given in accordance to the amount of contribution. Also, specific items will indicate how many VIP Values are required to redeem. It is important to note, VIP Values can redeem other items, including future products & services.

*Perks: the items or the choices are too many to list. However within each Perk area, ieCost has variety of choices and at the time of final selections all the possible choices will be available. 

Example: The Body Care products come in many possible fragrances and ingredients. So, simply enter the contribution amount corresponding to a Collection. After you receive a VIP Value Certificate and products become available on the ieCost web site, you will be able to confirm final selection.

VIP Specific-Value

Specific item or service. A service made available to you. A product shipped or you pick up at retail stores.

VIP Unit-Value

A Purchasing Value: Use to redeem the product from the ieCost web-network, from business clients, and retail stores. You choose your Product.

VIP Honor-Value

A Privilege Value: Provides the first right of choice. Used to place the contributor at the front of the list and can be used to guarantee entry to events & concerts or receive limited product & service offers.

The VIP Honor-Value guarantees you service above any consumer. As a funding contributor, ieCost gifts you the privilege of being first-to-be-served.

VIP Honor-Value Member

A Lifetime Member Privilege Value: Privileges are the same as the VIP Honor-Values. However, the amount of VIP Honor-Values is automatically renewed every year. You are a VIP Lifetime Member.

VIP Business-Value

Business Purchasing Value: Used to purchase products & services from the business category.

ieCost’s vendors, business clients, and personal resources have gifted the business category with tremendous gifts.

The VIP Business-Value *offered as a one-time opportunity and available during the project fundraising only, will be removed as limits are filled. So, act today!

The Products are given in good faith. ieCost will assure the highest quality to its funding contributors and will personally review & approve every step of the way until final delivery.

*OFFERS: the actual normal cost in the market for these products & services are 4 to 5 times more. 

VIP Exclusive Business Client

VIP Exclusive Business Client is a Privilege: Business fund contributor will automatically be included as an additional Exclusive Business Client. Tremendous Privilege: ieCost’s  filtered referrals (estimated in the millions) and access to exclusive marketing opportunities, which are specifically designed to dramatically increase market share.


AD PLACEMENT & BOOTH SPACE RATES

Advertising rates for websites, magazines, or events & concert spaces will be based on a fair market value comparison. ieCost guarantees incredible value.


TRANSFER TO ANOTHER VALUE

Business Contributors will be able to transfer “Value” to other business products and services. Also, ieCost will repackage VIP Values to satisfy contributors’ needs!

ieCost will make every effort to provide alternatives to satisfy the needs of funding contributors. If ieCost is not able to provide value equal or greater, the Business Contributor may request return of contributions, with the exception of the processing fees charged by Indiegogo, Credit Card, and PayPal, etc., at the time the contribution was made.


RIGHT OF REFUSAL

ieCost reserves the right of refusal if the contributor’s product or service is not in accordance with ieCost’s ethical values or any reason ieCost feels it does not fit. The contributions will be returned with the exception of the processing fees, charged by Indiegogo, Credit Card, and PayPal, etc., at the time the contribution was made.




FUND CONTRIBUTORS* WILL RECEIVE:

  1. Heartfelt appreciation from ieCost 

  2. Fund Contributors will be given Appreciation VIP Values. 
  3. Option to transfer VIP Values to other available products, including many more products in the future, as more business clients are added. 
  4. Mark of Distinction: Recognition, honor, and satisfaction of helping establish a socially responsible, new paradigm of social network company. 

    *Fund Contributions do not in any way provide legal ownership and profits sharing or shareholder rights. VIP Values have no redeemable cash value. Products and services to be available after official opening day, estimated July 2014. However, some products and services may have earlier or later delivery dates. 


A FEW ADDITIONAL EXAMPLES OF MANY TOP PRODUCTS & SERVICES, AND THE EVERYDAY SAVINGS ieCost WILL WORK TO MAKE AVAILABLE.



DOCTOR NATURE AND DOCTOR ORGANIC BODY & BEAUTY CARE: The highest of quality products. Normally, only for the privileged spa resorts patrons, movie stars, and elite department stores. You save up to 75%.

I WISH ALL YOUR WISHES AND MINE: Is a tale that celebrates friendship and well wishing. A boy and a girl meet and give each other their dreams in an imaginary journey for reader of all ages.

KEEP YOUR HOME: Stop the Bank! Save your home with the “Knowledge” real estate banking system. Reverse the mortgage, Re-mortgage in today’s market, and remove bad credit. (ieCost is working to provide this program totally free to homeowners.)

BUSINESS ENTREPRENEURSHIP SEMINARS: To Inspire entrepreneurship. Empower the businessperson to succeed.

WELLNESS COOKBOOK: The simple truth about food to stay healthy, thin, strong and beautiful.

OIL, TIRES, & BRAKES: Oil Change, Tire Rotation & Balance, and Brakes. Save 75%

CARE MAGAZINE, Wellness Health & Wealth: Everyday Wellness of Physical and Financial Health. Free!

Now you can have all the licensed official replica soccer jerseys and other apparel you want. What name or team do you want? Save up to 50%


TEENAGE AUTO INSURANCE: COST-LESS. Save. Put an end to that high cost.

DOCTORS ON CALL 24/7: $35 Low cost monthly service healthcare solution. Prevent unnecessary doctor and hospital visits. Save thousands of dollars. This service is offered to all.

GYM & TRAINERS: Get in and stay in healthy shape for less

SPA CENTERS & RESORTS: Pay less.

COST-LESS FLORIST FOR MEN: A service to help men give flowers.

MODELING FASHION FOR LIFE: A fashion and beauty modeling school for every day life to help young people balance the right ideas of fashion and beauty. 

MODELING FOR ADVERTISING: Modeling school for advertising. About 5% will or may appear on actual advertisements.

BREAST IMPLANTS: Pay less for the same quality.

NEW NONE-SURGICAL FACE & BODY REJUVENATING PROCEDURES: Look 10 years younger and pay a lot less.

NEW NON-SURGICAL GROWTH HAIR PROCEDURE: Look good. Pay less for faster results and a lot more hair.

HAIR REMOVAL: You pay less.

FIX A TOOTH: Pay a lot less.

EXCLUSIVE RESORT GET-AWAY VACATION: It is time to enjoy the money you save.


THE ieCost NEW PARADIGM OF BRAND, ADVERTISING, MARKETING COMPANY

ieCost is an integration of “New” brand-technology, advertising, and revolutionary grass-roots multi-dimensional marketing strategy company that results in a “Buyer’s Market” advantage for the consumer.

ieCost is also a mass-population brand advertising company that will work to provide multi-marketing opportunities with rapid and continuous market share growth for the benefit of its Exclusive Business Clients.


WHY A FOR-PROFIT COMPANY

ieCost is a for-profit company with a mission to minimize profit margin to directly maximize the consumer’s economic saving benefit. Success will be measured by the amount of money the consumer was able to save.


BENEFITS FOR BUSINESS CLIENTS:

  1. Develop and provide massive amounts of quality “consumers” to increased market share rapidly and continuously.

  2. Develop and provide mass marketing strategies to guarantee sales of top products & services.

  3. Insure increased revenue and profits without increasing Business Clients’ marketing expenses.

  4. Increase Business Client’s Brand equity.  


THE ieCost PROFESSIONALS

It is important to note that many professionals and vendor companies are ready to carry ieCost forward to great success. Many have provided “Time” effort and most have offered major contributions in products & services for funding contributors in hopes that ieCost will be fully funded.

However, ieCost will also be employing and utilizing the services of professionals and vendors to assure the success of the company.

Please feel free to refer any professionals or vendors to us.

Now, as for me, Martin V. Martos, I grew up with four family businesses that served the community for forty years. As a result, I have been in business my whole life.

I learned three things from my parents about business:
First, “If you work hard and serve from the heart people will come back.”
Second, “Make available products people want and they will buy.”
Third, “Do the first & second and the business will be successful.”

Also, I have been a professional in branding, advertising & marketing for 29 years. As a creative director, company manager, and advertising & marketing business owner my experience is extensive, from the largest American companies to start-ups businesses. Here is a very short list of companies I have helped:

Bank of America – Circle K – The Arizona Office of Tourism – Westin La Paloma – First Federal of Arizona Bank – MeraBank – The Arizona Bank – Western Savings Bank – Swensen’s Ice Cream – Red Mountain Ranch Community – Realty Executives – Gore-tex Medical Products – Partners Health – Samaritan Health – Arizona Healthcare – Birman Managed Care – Care3 – Health Unified – Memorial Hospital Health System – InterTel – CAM Technology-SolidWorks – Intel – AT&T– American Express.


The ieCost Referral Contest is a great way for you (individual or company) to start receiving some of the economic benefits. Use Indiegogo’s Share Tools!

REFERRAL CONTEST FOR INDIVIDUALS

FIRST: The individual with the most referrals who give at least one dollar or more to ieCost campaign will receive 1 VIP Honor-Value for every ten referrals. 

 SECOND: The individual with the highest fund contributions through referrals will receive
30 VIP Unit-Values (equals $30 of buying power) for every $1,000 in contributions.

REFERRAL CONTEST FOR COMPANIES (FOR-PROFIT & NON-PROFIT)

FIRST: The company with the most referrals who give at least one dollar or more to ieCost campaign will receive 1 VIP Honor-Value for every ten referrals.

SECOND: The company with the highest fund contributions through referrals will receive
30 VIP Unit-Values (equals $30 of buying power) for every $1,000 in contributions.

The VIP Honor-Value and VIP Unit-Values is a great way for companies to receive and then give gifts to customers and employees.


YOU CAN HELP

“You” can personally share the ieCost campaign in emails, Facebook, Twitter or any other social media avenue.

Share it with your friends, family, and on blogs. Please ask them to spread the word.

You can hand out cards at the mall and everywhere! 


ieCost WILL WORK TO CREATE AND PROVIDE THE BIGGEST SAVINGS:

Let it be understood that the many factors of business, changes in the market, and business negotiations will have a direct result on products and services – ultimately the total saving the consumers receive. ieCost reserves the right to remove products and services or change the savings value.

This includes the products and services offered on Indiegogo. Due to the laps of time: in the funding process, in establishing the ieCost corporation, and in final negotiations with the different companies… the savings value may vary. However it is ieCost goal to work to provide best prices on the market.

ieCost is a start-up company. With full funding, stage 1 & 2 required, ieCost will be able to work toward creating and providing the objectives of this socially responsible philanthropic company. 


Thank You! 
ieCost & Martin V. Martos
story_txt:
THE COMPANY:

A For-Profit, Socially Responsible, Social Network
Advertising and Marketing Company. 

ieCost is a for-profit, socially responsible, social network
advertising and marketing company that maximizes consumer savings by leveraging
consumers power to choose the products they want and by returning the
company’s profits to consumers in the form of savings on their purchases.
ieCost is designed for People and Families who want to pay
less on their EVERYDAY purchases. 
Using purchasing power to reestablish fair prices, the
Mission of ieCost is to facilitate economic betterment and wellness for all
people.
At ieCost, we earn revenue by mass-market Brand advertising
and marketing strategies; developing relationships among the ieCost consumers
and exclusive Businesses so that both benefit economically. 
ieCost then transfers its profits into financial
benefit–rewards for ieCost consumers.

THE WHY 
Directed by Social Responsibility, ieCost believes middle and
lower class working people need an economic break. As consumers they need to be
able to purchase everyday necessities at reasonable prices.

Middle and lower class working consumers deserve a
much-needed economic break. 
Hard-working People and Families must be able to afford more – to get much
more for their money.
Yet there is an increasingly disproportionate distribution
of wealth between today’s stockholders and today’s working consumers.
At ieCost we recognize the consumer has a direct impact on any
company's success; the consumer is investing his/her money when purchasing a
product. 
Therefore, we believe that the consumer should reap a
financial reward in accordance with the success of the companies they chose to
support, just like a stockholder.
We at ieCost are committed to that principle with our hearts,
minds, spirits, and with our profits.
THE
HOW
It is simple: Only with your help! Only You, consumers, can
help create a company for consumers. Voice your choice by . . . 
Giving at least one dollar . . . 
Telling at least one person about ieCost . . . 
Join millions of consumers finally able to have the opportunity
to benefit from their own purchases.
Let’s Create: a philanthropic company.

HOW
ieCost WORKS:
Online Registration at ieCost.com “There are No Fees” 
Become an ieCost Consumer
Buy at Cost. Buy online or retail stores. Every day, all
year long, buy only top quality products & services you normally buy.
Get incredible promotional offers, up to 100% free from
ieCost. 
You get it totally free: Entertainment & food for the
whole family. ieCost will provide its promotional community events &
concerts. 












                     SAVE on everything you
normally buy everyday, all year with the “You-Save Card.”                       • Savings are in addition to any store discounts, coupons,
or promotions.









                      Save all year long every time you pump gas.
“Cost-Less Gas Card”                       Save 5% to 10%. Families will save thousands of dollars “Cost-Less Grocery Card”                       • Savings are in addition to any store discounts, coupons,
or promotions.                       • Even if you use Food Stamps you can still save.
                       Up to
80% savings. Buying at cost. Pharmacy and over-the-counter drugs.                       Use the “Cost-Less Pharmacy Card.” 
                      Your-Doctor… local
doctors working together.                       Use the “Doctors Cost-Less Card.” 
                      EVENTS & CONCERTS FOR YOUR COMMUNITY: Totally free                       entertainment & food
for the whole family--festivals, carnivals, and                       health fairs, top chart
artists, performers, and sport professionals.

___________________________________________________________________________________

IN ADDITION PLEASE NOTE: Products & services will be available to the ieCost Consumers. However, these existing incredible values are offered to fund
contributors only, at this time. 
PLEASE NOTE BELOW: Additional examples of the many top products & services
and the everyday savings that ieCost will work to make available. 

___________________________________________________________________________________
FIRST: Make a Contribution of any size. Even if it is only a $1, it will help fund ieCost and achieve our goals. SECOND: Take advantage, of the ieCost REFERRAL CONTEST: 

You as an individual have the opportunity to win big prizes. This is a fantastic way for non-profit organizations and for-profit companies
to receive great prizes. (See details below.)
Tell everyone you know about ieCost. Use Indiegogo’s Share
Tools. Send a message to your whole list of contacts: Emails, Twitter, Text,
Facebook, LinkedIn, Blogs and all other networks.
Remember: Call or email your favorite non-profit
organizations, tell your neighbors, and tell strangers at the mall. Tell every
one you see. 
Challenge everyone to make a Contribution. Challenge each
one to tell everyone about ieCost. 
Re-send the message. Everyone needs
reminders. 










FIRST $50,000

STAGE 1:    ESTABLISH TO-DO BUSINESS REQUIREMENTS & SALES
STRATEGIES  (3 to 4 months) Estimated benefits to ieCost Consumers encompassed in
conditional contracts of “Stage 1” with the business clients is around 3 to 7 million dollars. 

GOALS ALREADY ACHIEVED (Donated effort: $105,000): a. Developed business & marketing model and implementation strategies,
    initial contacts, & business agreements with parties. 
b. Researched & defined & developed requirements for production, marketing, and
execution. 
c. Pre-arrangements with the supporting vendors, businesses, and professionals.


GOALS TO ACHIEVE (Time effort is donated: $70,000): a. Implement presentation and full-scale sales strategies. b. Obtain conditional contracts from 20 national business clients (need only
5). Also, per     region: 20 large businesses and 20 start-ups or
small businesses (need only 10 of each). c. Finalize contracts of already-obtained agreements with supporting vendors,
businesses,     and professionals. d. With conditional contracts in effect, define & develop requirements of
implementation for     marketing of the business clients’ products and services.


FUNDS TO PAY LEGAL FEES: a. Implement all legal requirements to conduct business, corporate, and
contractual 


FUNDS TO PAY PROFESSIONAL FEES: a. Implement all accounting and company structure 

FUNDS TO PAY PERSONAL & GENERAL COST: 
a. Staff three office support personnel 
b. Freelance two to four graphic artists & production assistants 
c. Sales meeting/meals & travel for five Sales coordinators     (Note:
coordinators will donate time effort of $10,000 each)



ADDITIONAL $100,000
STAGE 2:    100% BUSINESS READY IMPLEMENTATION: TAKE-TO-MARKET
(4 to 6 months) 

GOALS TO ACHIEVE: 
a. Finalize one-year full commitment contracts from business clients and
vendorsb. Finalize three to five year full commitment contracts from national business
clients     and vendors 


GOALS TO ACHIEVE: 
a. ieCost will be completely self-sustainable 


FUNDS TO PAY PERSONAL & GENERAL COST: a. Take-to-market: Full production and implementation b. Staff support personnel as required by growth c. Freelance graphic artists & production individuals as required by growth d. Web & IT Support






ANY ADDITIONAL FUNDS ABOVE $150,000
STAGE 3:    ieCost BUSINESS EXPANSION (4 to 7 years) Any additional funding will help in a quicker expansion
across America. Estimated need: $25,000 per major market.
Estimates in total economic saving benefit to ieCost Consumers across America felicitated directly or indirectly by ieCost are
incredible.
GOALS TO ACHIEVE: a. Implement ieCost’s business model fully onto top 100
markets and all across America.

consumers receive. ieCost reserves the right to remove products and services or
change the savings value. 
This includes the products and
services offered on Indiegogo. Due to the laps of time: in the funding process,
in establishing the ieCost corporation, and in final negotiations with the
different companies… the savings value may vary. However it is ieCost goal to
work to provide best prices on the market.
ieCost is a start-up company. With
full funding, stage 1 & 2 required, ieCost will be able to work toward
creating and providing the objectives of this socially responsible
philanthropic company. Thank You! ieCost & Martin V. Martos

story:
I would like to thank myotishi of DeviantART.com for permitting my use of the blanket image on the page! Awesome art work! :)

Short Summary

  • My name is Josh and I moved to Philadelphia from Long Island in 2008 to attend Temple University. I graduated in May and currently work in the city.
  • I am collecting small donations and buying items in bulk online. I have also been collecting slightly worn clothing to give out. I hope to also start putting together small care packages consisting of hand/foot warmers, band-aids and disinfectant cream, granola bars, and other helpful items. That is the main reason for creating this project on Indiegogo.
  • I cannot say I will be helping every person in need in Philadelphia or even a majority of them. I am simply working by myself to collect and hand out items, usually before and after work as well as my days off. My idea is pretty simple. Help homeless people stay warmer during the winter.

What We Need & What You Get

  • As far as the amount of funding goes, if I make 5$USD I would be more than satisfied. All of the money goes directly to buying these types of bulk items online. As i mentioned above, I want to expand what I am giving out. I thought about it one day when a man told me he waited in the E.R. for 4 hours to get band-aids for his infected toe. I would like to continue helping people after winter ends and these care packages would be a fantastic way to start.
  • My mother always talked about doing something like this in NYC when I was a kid and although we never did, I thought now would be a good time to start. It is supposed to be a very cold winter and the Farmers Almanac is not usually wrong. In my personal experience, I have a found some people are not very giving with money for those in need and to the homeless. I feel that this is partially due to certain stigmas attached to where that money may go. That is why I began collecting money to purchase items myself and hand them out. This way donors are confident their money is well used and those in need are given beneficial items. 
  • I would have chosen NO goal is the option existed. Any amount collected from .50$USD to 1,000,000.00$USD(joking :P) will 100% be put towards purchasing items for those in need. I am willing and able to provide receipts for online transactions so donors can really see where their money goes. Blankets, socks, scarves, gloves, hats, backpacks, jackets, sweaters, and hopefully care packages in the near future. Anything and everything can help in some way! :)

The Impact

  • Every time you put a sweater on to keep warm, there are people who cannot do that. I simply want the number of people who can't do that to be less.
  • This is my first attempt. I began about two months ago. So far I have collected around 70 pairs of socks, 30 blankets, 25 backpacks, more hats and gloves than I can count, 10 jackets, a few pairs of pajama pants, 1 pair of boots, and 1 pair of women's jeans. I hope to continue doing this as long as possible.
  • I usually try to sit and chat with people as I am giving things out, partially to find out what things would be most useful for them and because it is always nice to meet new people.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I personally do not use facebook or any other social media sites. If people could simply post a link to this page it would be GREATLY appreciated :). Thanks and have a fantastic day! --Josh Snyder.

story:
Short Summary

In April of 2005, my husband took me to an old beat up firehouse and asked me to look past the boxes of junk, the layers of dirt and cobwebs, the three broken down cars parked in the engine bay and imagine a restaurant instead.  At first I thought he was crazy, but then I got it. We spent the next 6 months researching and writing a business plan and another 12 months trying to convince anyone else we were on to something. After countless hours of renovating, rebuilding, cleaning, painting, staining, stressing, and too many setbacks to remember, we opened our doors in December 2006.

When we first planned the business, I thought we'd open a nice little restaurant, make a decent living and be good to go. I had no idea of what an impact it would have on our lives, on our employees (past and present) and our community. I also had no idea that we were about to go into a recession and that we couldn't have picked a worse time for this (buying and renovating the building in the height of the real estate market when everything cost the most, followed by opening at the start of one of the worst economies ever when people started to reel in their personal spending).

I need your help now to keep the doors open.  This is important to me on many levels.

While I have three children of my own, it's like I've adopted 25-35 more on any given day through my employees. I care about and worry about these people as if they were my own kids.

  • We have one "kid" who started with us the very first day as a 14 year old dishwasher and is now a 21 year old kitchen manager.
  • We have cooks who have been with us for 5-6-7 years, which is rare in this business.
  • There have probably been 40 other "kids" who have gotten their first real job with us - in a small town with no public transportation, that is saying a lot. It has allowed them to go on to other places and have something real to include on a job application.
  • We have enabled stay-at-home moms to help support their families with a part-time job, helped many keep their cars or houses when they thought they couldn't make the payments.
  • We've helped more than one employee deal with addiction and mental health issues by tracking down the help they need while allowing them to keep their jobs.

The thought of closing and leaving all of my employees unemployed keeps me up at night.

The impact on the community has been larger than we ever imagined as well. There is something that makes you all warm and fuzzy when you see people greeting others in a genuinely happy and friendly way and this happens all the time here.  We also have one confirmed marriage in a relationship that started when they met for the first time at our restaurant, came in often on dates, and then actually got engaged in the restaurant! We've raised thousands of dollars for schools, a young local girl who was hit by a car and seriously injured, a local organization that brings terminally ill children and their families to the beach, a police officer killed in the line of duty. We've witnessed first dates, breakups, more than one marriage proposal, weddings, baby showers, girls nights, a large group of retired firefighters meeting every month for lunch. I realize we aren't curing cancer or solving world peace, but I do feel like it matters that we are here.

The most important reason I have to get funding and keep the doors open are my kids.  They were almost 7, almost 4 and 18 months old when we opened and are now almost 14, almost 11 and 8. They have sacrificed more than anyone while we have worked and stressed and worked and stressed. They have been resilient and patient and healthy and challenging and I know how lucky I am to have them. I don't want their sacrifice to be for nothing.

I have had real struggles lately about how I am not doing enough to make the world a better place and I feel like I am constantly reminded about others who are making a profound difference. But in my own little part of the world, and in the worlds of my employees and family, I'd like to think that what I am doing is making things better and so it is that important to me to continue.


What We Need and What You Get

I am hoping to raise $10,000. To some people this is a small amount of money (I just don't know any of those people!). To me, this is a huge amount of money. 

  • It will be used to get people in to the restaurant - sprucing up the landscaping, getting a new stand up ashtray for outside, a new state flag and restaurant flag (I've already replaced the American flag), getting our website current and running, getting a direct mail campaign out, buying tshirts and other merchandise to sell for the holidays, paying off some past due bills. There are all these little things that make a huge difference in how people perceive the restaurant, but I just don't have the cash.
  • In return, depending on your donation, you will get: a souvenir patch or pin, a beer coozie, a free BBQ Pork sandwich (if you are local!), the opportunity to spend the night with me (in the kitchen!) or a few days with me (in the restaurant!)
  • Any and all funds will be used towards operating costs of the restaurant no matter how much we raise.


My plan is this:

  • If we are able to raise funds and stay in business, then in one year from our campaign's end, I will return to indiegogo and as I am able, I will fund projects in amounts equal to whatever we raise.  That is, if you help save us, I will do what I can to help someone else.
  • We have made it this far and will not give up, but we could really use some help. I can't articulate how strongly I believe that our restaurant can survive with just a little help.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a monetary donation, you can still help!

  • Let people you know who might be interested and a position to help about us.
  • Come to the restaurant, tell your friends to come to the restaurant, post positive reviews about us online!

story:
NEWS Coverage of our campaign - links below:

Gazette & Washington Post 

The VOICE (Takoma Park / Silver Spring

Tadias (US-Ethiopian Publication)

Silver Spring Patch


Blessed Coffee is founded on the philosophy of "from the farmer to your cup." 

Established as a socially responsible business and trade geared towards development in coffee growing regions, as well as in communities in the US where coffee is sold. Now Blessed Coffee seeks to build a cafe in Takoma Park, MD.

Blessed Coffee is:

  1. The first business ever to implement the Virtuous Exchange (www.brewingchange.us/virtuous-exchange/) model.
  2. The Nation’s second Benefit Corporation, a new law introduced by Maryland in 2010 to support social entrepreneurs advancing public benefit as well as profit. Now enacted in 20 States.
  3. Designed to advance social/cultural and economic development in coffee growing regions as well as communities in the US.

It offers investment partnership and dynamic profit sharing to 240,000 small coffee growers in Ethiopia (making them major stakeholders) representing over a million families. It will give back 50% of the profit from the wholesale business to the farmers.

Providing similar investment opportunity to the community in the US and donating 50% of the profit from the café to local organizations producing public good in the US.

Since the inauguration of Blessed Coffee in 2011, Tebabu and Sara (husband/wife team and founders) have shared their story about and aspirations for developing Blessed Coffee, one cup and one conversation at a time at their dinner table, farmers markets, community events, colleges campuses, sustainable business forums and festivals. In just two years, they have come a long way.

Today, they enjoy massive community support, valuable recognition from policy makers, and broad media coverage. Their story is reaching many across the nation and beyond.

  • September 2011 - MD Governor Martin O’Malley, during his Blessed Coffee inauguration address, says of the business that it, “stands at the intersection of profits and social responsibility.”
  • January 2012 - The White House awards Blessed Coffee with the “Champion of Change” recognition.
  • The award honors ordinary Americans who are doing extraordinary things in their communities to out-innovate, out-educate, and out-build the rest of the world.
  • June 2012 - Edible DC, a Washington DC based food magazine, features a cover story recognizing Blessed Coffee as one of the 16 “Game Changers” in the local sustainable food sector.
  • September 2012 - At the Second Blessed Coffee Anniversary, MD Senator Jamie Raskin, the Keynote Speaker, named Blessed Coffee “Community in a Cup”
  • May 2013 - MD Senator Ben Cardin mentions Blessed Coffee in his keynote address at the USAID Small Business Conference, citing it as “an outstanding example of innovative socially conscious international businesses”
  • September 2013 - Blessed Coffee is invited to introduce its social business model at the Africa Braintrust event, an annual US-African Trade Investment forum hosted by Congresswoman Karen Bass at the 43 Annual Congressional Black Caucus Foundation Conference.

Fund Utilizations.

It is with a strong sense of accomplishment and solid confidence our continued growth - on our third anniversary - we are launching this crowd-funding campaign developed to support Blessed Coffee in raising the necessary capital to open its first café and roasting facility.  Yes, Blessed Coffee is destined to be a model for social and economic development in the Coffee growing region and our community here in the US. And yes, we are singing … “Ain't no stoppin' us now…We're on the move”…

And your support will help us get there. Below is the chart that shows you the the fund utilizations.

Virtuous Exchange

Virtuous Exchange (www.brewingchange.us/virtuous-exchange/) embraces Fair Trade’s principles of helping producers in developing countries obtain fair prices, ethical treatment of workers, and environmentally sustainable practices.

Virtuous Exchange goes beyond Fair Trade to:

  • Provide producers with significantly higher benefit—sharing up to 50% of profits.
  • Offer producers attainable investment opportunity—making possible an ownership stake in the business.
  • Recognize and appreciate the human element inherent in trade. Producers become more than commodities. Their cultural and social traditions are honored and shared in every transaction.
  • Set a higher bar for socially conscious businesses. Rather than simply meeting a set of
  • standards, VE asks businesses to be in real relationship with producers and consumers and uniquely connect them in ways that have the best interests of both, and our world, at heart.

The Culture of Ethiopian Coffee

Ethiopia is the birthplace of coffee and their ancient coffee ceremony is a tradition that is woven into the fabric of Ethiopia’s culture, community life, and spiritual identity. For thousands of years, coffee ceremonies have been conducted daily where coffee is roasted, ground, and brewed three times. It is a social gathering where dreams are translated, blessings are offered, and social relations and discourse are fostered to build engaged communities.

Blessed Coffee intertwines ancient and vibrant cultural traditions with a business model that celebrates community and advances social and economic development.

Blessed Coffee is also proud to bring you the finest coffee varieties from Ethiopia, where the soil, altitude, and climate are ideal for producing truly outstanding coffee grown by farmers who have cultivated the bean for thousands of years.

The Global Coffee Trade

After crude oil, coffee is the most sought commodity in the world. It is a worth over a $100 billion dollars worldwide. In this market, ultra premium coffee beans are taken from small farmers at pennies on the dollar. The beans are then mixed into large batches with cheap, plantation-produced coffee, and then branded and labeled as a “fancy blend” by wholesalers, retailers, and upscale coffee shops.

In this profit driven market, farmers who contribute 90% of the work only get 1% of the retail price. With this meager share, farmers struggle to make a living and cannot afford to eat a decent meal and send their kids to school.

Brewing Change

The Brewing Change Campaign is a crowd-funding campaign developed to raise the capital necessary for expansion of Blessed Coffee into retail business markets and allow for the more complete implementation of its Virtuous Exchange business model.

The members of the Brewing Change campaign team come from a diversity of backgrounds, but have each been drawn to Brewing Change because of Blessed Coffee’s socially conscious and sustainable business practices. Team members represent the breadth of skills and professions found in the Washington DC Metro Area—art, law, organizational development, communications, technology, community activism and real estate.

The Story, One Family Building a Social Business Tebabu and Sara (husband & wife team), both native Ethiopians, founded Blessed Coffee in 2011 in their hometown of Takoma Park, MD. They are both community activists; social entrepreneurs; and the proud parents of two children, Helena and Yared.

Tebabu and Sara were inspired to develop the Virtuous Exchange business model and Blessed Coffee after meeting fellow Ethiopian activist Tadesse Meskela in 2002 in Washington DC. Tadesse is the founder and general manager of the Oromia Coffee Farmers Co- operative Union (OCFCU), with 240,000 small coffee framing members. It was through Tadesse that Tebabu and Sara learned of the tremendous inequities in the global coffee market and the devastating impact on small farmers.

Tebabu and Sara have been growing their wholesale business and spreading the message about Virtuous Exchange via farmers markets, e-commerce, partner organizations, and traditional brick and mortar grocery stores. In 2012, Edible DC magazine recognized the couple among its notable “Game Changers” revolutionizing the Washington DC food scene. Blessed Coffee is destined to do more for its local community than Starbucks has for Seattle! It is with a strong sense of accomplishment--on the occasion of Blessed Coffee’s third anniversary--that Tebabu and Sara (with the support of the Brewing Change team) launch this crowd-funding campaign developed to support Blessed Coffee in raising the necessary capital to open its first café and roasting facility.

Brewing Change

We hope that you will support the campaign and help propel Blessed Coffee into a bright and prosperous future of positive social, cultural, and economic impact.

Tebabu and Sara were inspired to develop the Virtuous Exchange business model and Blessed Coffee after meeting fellow Ethiopian activist Tadesse Meskela in 2002 in Washington DC. Tadesse is the founder and general manager of the Oromia Coffee Farmers Co- operative Union (OCFCU), with 240,000 small coffee framing members. It was through Tadesse that Tebabu and Sara learned of the tremendous inequities in the global coffee market and the devastating impact on small farmers.
Tebabu and Sara have been growing their wholesale business and spreading the message about Virtuous Exchange via farmers markets, e-commerce, partner organizations, and traditional brick and mortar grocery stores. In 2012, Edible DC magazine recognized the couple among its notable “Game Changers” revolutionizing the Washington DC food scene. Blessed Coffee is destined to do more for its local community than Starbucks has for Seattle! It is with a strong sense of accomplishment--on the occasion of Blessed Coffee’s third anniversary--that Tebabu and Sara (with the support of the Brewing Change team) launch this crowd-funding campaign developed to support Blessed Coffee in raising the necessary capital to open its first café and roasting facility.
Brewing Change
We hope that you will support the campaign and help propel Blessed Coffee into a bright and prosperous future of positive social, cultural, and economic impact.

story:
Hey guys! As most of you probably know, Jon took an insane, 3000-mile motorcycle trip from New York to California this summer. Both Jon and his motorcycle defied everyone's expectations and somehow survived the journey, but last night someone stole his bike. 

RIP, faithful steed. 



What We Need & What You Get

Let's help Jon get some new wheels!  Even if you can only throw in a few bucks, it all makes a difference. 




The Impact

Even if Jon doesn't plan on making another suicidally dangerous cross country trip anytime soon, I'm sure he needs a way to get around. If you've ever been to San Francisco, you know that the public transportation is pretty sad compared to what we have in NYC.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I've made a facebook group to help promote the campaign. It has open membership, so feel free to invite people to contribute or to just get the word out.

story:
Wishful Smiles will be going out to India this year to conduct their first International project to help the most disadvantaged and underprivileged communities to combat poverty, famine, social injustice and illiteracy by providing financial and material aid to those unable to support their families, education to children, clean drinking water and healthcare to barren villages. 

In association with ‘Stop Acid Attacks’ SAA, we want to help raise awareness and funds for acid attack victims and support them through their hardships.

This particular fundraiser will be in aid to help victims of barbaric acid attacks. 100% of all your kind donations will go to its cause via 'Stop Acid Attacks' SAA. 

Perpetrators of these attacks throw acid at their victims, usually at their faces, burning them, and damaging skin tissue, often exposing and sometimes dissolving the bones. The long term consequences of these attacks include blindness and permanent scarring of the face and body.


Stop Acid Attacks (SAA) is a campaign against acid violence. A survivor of an acid attack requires immediate medical, financial and psychological support on human grounds. They work by generating immediate medical and financial support for the victims and providing them and their families the needed psychological and legal support.

They work as a bridge between survivors and the society, as many victims tend to isolate after losing their faces, hibernating into their solitude and misery, due to the ignorance of the government and civil society. Since the country has never had any study to assess the situation of survivors who face the brutal aftermath of acid attacks, SAA aims at researching and tracking more acid attack case to compile a data to assess the actual situation of victims.


Through their initiative called 'Chhanv - an adobe for acid attack they provide a shelter home to acid attack survivors undergoing treatment in New Delhi. Located in Laxminagar, Delhi, it is first of its kind rehabilitation centre in the country. Chhanv is a ray of hope for all the acid attack fighters who have been struggling with their fate all alone, as the centre not only provides shelter to them during their medical treatment, but also helps them take charge of their lives after such a ghastly incident. The centre is managed and run by acid attack fighters who have recovered with their true grit and thus, is a source of inspiration and motivation for many others, who are often deserted by the hypocritical society; in some cases even by their own families. 

We may not be able to recover their faces, but we can heal their hearts. 

Please donate generously and help us to help victims of such barbaric attacks. Thank you we really appreciate your support.

story:
On 13 May 2014, an explosion at the coal mine in Soma, Manisa, Turkey caused an underground fire which burned until 15 May. Over 423 people were killed in what was the worst mine disaster in Turkey's history. 

Turkish government is cencoring all news from this region.

These miners made about £400 a month and were the sole breadwinners in the family. With this campaign we are trying to help those who are now facing bankcruptcy without no breadwinners.

Can you please help

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soma_mine_disaster


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends and family to contribute. Use the sharing tools on this Indiegogo page.

story:
Summary

Celebrate the life of
Harold Larson And support the Harold Larson Williamston Food Bank

About The Williamston
Food Bank

The Harold Larson Williamston
Food Bank is a non-profit organization that provides emergency food to
individuals and families in need in Williamston, MI school district. Food is
distributed through an extensive network of partners and volunteers in the
Williamston area. The Williamston Food Bank annually serves thousands of
people, many of them seniors and children. Recipients also include those
families and individuals who are employed but don’t earn enough to meet
housing, health, transportation and food needs.

History

The Harold Larson Williamston Food Bank was officially started by Harold and Margaret Larson in 1970, however, the couple had been helping Williamston residents in need long before that. As Harold told it, he and Margaret received help from their neighbors back in the late 1940's when he was struck down with polio and was unable to work for a year. During those "lean" times, the Larson’s realized how important it was to help out friends and neighbors who had fallen on hard
times. The kindness they received inspired them to give back to others, and for
nearly 50 years, this amazing couple helped countless needy families throughout
our community. Today, the food bank serves families, large and small, single parents, the elderly, the unemployed and underemployed, providing food and personal items to those in the Williamston community who need help. In the last five years, the Williamston Food Bank has grown from serving 25-30 families each month to over 100.

Harold R. Larson was born January 29, 1924 to Raymond and Astrid (Swartstrom) Larson, and passed away May 29, 2014 at age 90. Harold served in the US Army Signal Core in WW11, and was stationed in England where he met his wife Margaret (Duckham) Larson, and they recently celebrated their 68th wedding anniversary. He enjoyed being a mail courier for the U.S. Postal Service for 30 years, was a longtime winning coach for girls' softball, and was a Williamston School Board Member. Harold was the founder of the Williamston Christmas Clearing Bureau, which gave families toys and Christmas dinner. This led to the founding of the Williamston Food Bank to distribute food to the community all year round. He found it very rewarding to handle and store hospital equipment to loan to at-need families through the American Legion. Harold was the very first person to be awarded the "Williamston Citizen of The Year" through Kiwanis.



 On September 20, 2014 there will be an event to celebrate the life and community service of Harold Larson at the American Legion Band Shell located at McCormick Park in Williamston, Michigan. This event will also be a fundraiser for the Harold Larson Williamston Food Bank. Admission is free however there is a suggested donation of non-perishable food items to be given to the Food Bank. Members of Harold’s family will be present and there will be a variety of live music. 

The bands are as follows:

11am to Noon  Shotguns & Violins

12:30pm to 1:30pm  North Country Flyers

2pm to 3pm  Sugar Hook

3:30pm to 4:30pm  Still Rain Band

We are also going to try and get a bounce house and other games for the kids.  All proceeds will be given to the Williamston Food Bank.



  

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds we raise will be used to cover the costs of the event. EVERY PENNY over our costs will be donated directly to the Food Bank. While there are no perks because the donation levels are so low (so people can afford to contribute), you will have the satisfaction of knowing you have given to a VERY good cause. The Williamston Food Bank is a 501.3(c) and if you need a receipt for the tax donation, please let us know.

The Impact

This event will make more people aware of the impact that Harold Larson AND his family have had on our community and will provide support for more families in need. 
If you can't contribute, PLEASE pass this on to EVERYONE you know and help us make this a successful event!

story:
Iris Nashville has existed as a city wide worship gathering on Sunday nights for about three years. We started in a house and haven't looked back since. Now, we're church planting!

We need your help! We're transforming McCabe Park Community Center in West Nashville into a home for our church family!

We'll host our first ever, Sunday morning service on September 14th, 2014.

We need supplies for children's church, some sound equipment, a stage, and some extra lighting.

We need to raise $30,000 to make this possible!

We're going to "The Nations"!

If you know much about Iris Global, you know that our movement is extremely missional. Following suit, we're moving into a part of our city that is in great need of the Gospel.

The McCabe Park Community center is located in a trendy neighborhood called Sylvan Park. It's home to many young families and amazing local businesses. It's located just a few miles from Vanderbilt University. This is a perfect location for us!

Not far from Sylvan Park, is a neighborhood known as "The Nations". Our city is currently experiencing a massive housing boom and The Nations have now become a new focus for many major developers due to it's cheap real estate.

When the old prison was in operation, a lot of family members of the convicts moved to this area as well as guards. People moved from all over and the area attracted a lot of diversity, sparking the nickname, "The Nations". 

Just last week, The Nashville Scene, a premiere local magazine did a cover story on the neighborhood. There are many impoverished people living there, in need of both spiritual and practical help.

Sowing into this church plant is not only going to help us start successfully, minister to families and college students, but also to move into this part of our city and serve our local poor!

    Our purpose is to love God, love people, and change the world.

    We've spent the last three years loving God together as a family. Now, it's time to plant our church right in the middle of a neighborhood that needs our help!

    Help us get the word out!

    This can't happen without your support. Please share this page with your friends and help us meet our goal of $30,000 in 30 days. Thanks for getting behind Iris Nashville, Iris Global, and all that we're endeavoring to do around the world with Jesus. Let's make history together!

    You're invited to join us for our first Sunday morning service at McCabe Park Community Center on September 14th, 2014!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

We are a team of three high school juniors working with police forces in the Greater Boston area to help return stolen bikes back to their owners.  Biking riding is on the rise in the Boston area and across the US, as many commuters have realized that the low cost and athletic nature of biking is preferable to owning and maintaining a car. Unfortunately, the increase in bike ridership has coincided with an increase in theft. Omnibike helps to get stolen bikes back by bridging the gap between the bicycles recovered by police and their owners.

"Each year, somewhere between 800,000 and two million bicycles—worth some $50 million—are stolen... 48% of stolen bikes are recovered by law enforcement, only 5% of stolen bikes are returned to their owners."

 

In October of 2013, we entered into a business plan competition, with our main idea being the return of stolen bikes through a serial number database. After this, we decided to bring our idea to life. We partnered with local and University police forces from places like Cambridge, Brookline, Belmont, Harvard, and MIT, and enlisted them to help return stolen bikes using our system.

The contributions from this campaign will allow us to register as a LLC, pay a web designer to create a high quality website accessible by the police and the public and bring the business to life.


How It Works

Our bike recovery system revolves around the use of serial codes found on the underside of every bike. Across the nation, many bikes are stolen, and subsequently recovered by police forces. These bikes cannot be linked to an owner, leaving police stations with rooms of stolen, unclaimed bikes. Using our system, a member of the police would catalog a bike's serial number when it was recovered, and if this number matched one already registered in the online code bank, the owner would be notified that their stolen bike was recovered.


Funding

Our funding goal is $5000. This money will mainly be put towards the creation of our website. We will be using anywhere from $2,000-$4,000 of our funds to pay a website developer to create our website and database for identification codes. Another portion of the money will go towards registering as a LLC, legitimizing our business. Any remaining money will be put towards future website modifications and marketing material.


The Impact

Bike theft is an growing issue in many towns and cities, causing huge property loss, and little after theft recovery. We hope to expand as quickly as we can to bring our service to as many people as possible. The more people who are part of our database, the more access the police have to stolen bikes, and the more useful our system becomes. By creating and expanding Omnibike, we are addressing the problem of bike theft in our community and the surrounding area, and returning stolen goods back to their rightful owners.


Risks & Challenges

One of the major difficulties we may face is if a major police force does not partner with us and creates a hole in our coverage. We will manage this risk by leveraging our existing relationship with the Cambridge Police with whom we have already established a strong relationship.  Another issue is the age of the co-founders. Because all three co-founders are minors, some business matters go slowly, or need to be done through a surrogate, which can cause greater complication.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, there is plenty you can do to help us achieve our goal. Go to our Facebook page and like or share us. Talk about us to a friend or family member who you think might be interested. Use the Indigogo share tools to help spread word of our campaign. Above all, help us get the word out about Omnibike, and the simple system to help prevent bike theft. Thanks!

story:
résumé

I am the Center Director of a NGO in Madagascar. My NGO specializes in mobilizing youth to volunteer and do community services.

8 years ago, after my wedding, I moved to the Capital city of Madagascar and was appointed to become the Co-ordinator of the organization. As people did not know our organization well, they did not want to support us, but we were not discouraged. To financially support the work at that time, two of my team and I were selling newpapers on the street, we also went to some universities and companies. 

8 years later, we are now a NGO. We have about 40 volunteers serving the communities in different areas: doing psychosocial activities at the prison, teaching life skills at schools, taking care of the shelter of the patients coming from all over Madagascar during the Operation Smile free surgery,..Because of the work my team and I have done, I was one of the 7 young Malagasy Leaders in Madagascar selected by the US government  to attend the YALI Washington fellowship program of President Obama. 

My project is to buy a property to host our Training, Leadership and Development Center (TLDC). The majority of the Malagasy population are youth. If properly trained, equipped and empowered, they will greatly impact the different development aspects of our communities. We have seen that through the various projects we have done so far. This center will really help us to mobilize thousands of young people which we could not do yet up to now as we do not have a center but rent a one-room office.

I believe you can support us in making this dream come true.
The property as explained in the video is USD120,000. Before I left, we raised USD4,000. The remaining amount is then USD116,000

Whatever your contribution is, we will make sure that we write your name on a special stone within the property when we get it. If we could not raise the amount needed by August 10, we will buy a plot with the money and then start to do another fundraising to build a smaller center.

Your contribution will help us promote the importance of volunteerism and engage young people in community services. The center will also create jobs for young people and will be a school for future leaders who will become change agents in our country.

The challenge is the deadline: August 10. But I firmly believe that there are lots of people like you in all over the world who are ready to contribute and that will make a HUGE difference.

So please share to many as possible my story/my organization's story. One way to do it is to use the Indiegogo sharing tool.

To end up, Thank you so very much. I appreciate your willingness to support.

Jean Clement ANDRIAMANAMPISOA
story_txt:
résumé
I am the Center Director of a NGO in Madagascar. My NGO specializes in mobilizing youth to volunteer and do community services. 
8 years ago, after my wedding, I moved to the Capital city of Madagascar and was appointed to become the Co-ordinator of the organization. As people did not know our organization well, they did not want to support us, but we were not discouraged. To financially support the work at that time, two of my team and I were selling newpapers on the street, we also went to some universities and companies. 
8 years later, we are now a NGO. We have about 40 volunteers serving the communities in different areas: doing psychosocial activities at the prison, teaching life skills at schools, taking care of the shelter of the patients coming from all over Madagascar during the Operation Smile free surgery,..Because of the work my team and I have done, I was one of the 7 young Malagasy Leaders in Madagascar selected by the US government  to attend the YALI Washington fellowship program of President Obama.
